Technical Report of â€œFaithful Edge Federated Learning: Scalability and Privacyâ€

IX Technical Report of â€œFaithful Edge Federated Learning: Scalability and Privacyâ€

IX-A Proof of Proposition 1 and Corollary 1

In this appendix, we prove Proposition 1, which also proves Corollary 1 as a special case (pk=1subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜1p_{k}=1 and pj=0subscriptğ‘ğ‘—0p_{j}=0 for all jâ‰ kğ‘—ğ‘˜j\neq k).

We start with the following the Hoeffdingâ€™s Inequality. Consider independent Xiâˆˆ[ai,bi]subscriptğ‘‹ğ‘–subscriptğ‘ğ‘–subscriptğ‘ğ‘–X_{i}\in[a_{i},b_{i}] and their sum, Sn=âˆ‘i=1nXisubscriptğ‘†ğ‘›superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘›subscriptğ‘‹ğ‘–S_{n}=\sum_{i=1}^{n}X_{i}. The Hoeffdingâ€™s Inequality states that

Prâ€‹(Snâˆ’ğ”¼â€‹[Sn]â‰¥Ïµ)â‰¤expâ¡(âˆ’2â€‹Ïµ2âˆ‘i=1n(biâˆ’ai)2).Prsubscriptğ‘†ğ‘›ğ”¼delimited-[]subscriptğ‘†ğ‘›italic-Ïµ2superscriptitalic-Ïµ2superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘›superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘–subscriptğ‘ğ‘–2\displaystyle{\rm Pr}(S_{n}-\mathbb{E}[S_{n}]\geq\epsilon)\leq\exp\left(\frac{-2\epsilon^{2}}{\sum_{i=1}^{n}(b_{i}-a_{i})^{2}}\right). (62)

The optimality condition of (11) is

âˆ‘kâˆˆğ’¦pkâ€‹âˆ‡ğ’˜Fkâ€‹(ğ’˜o)=ğŸ.subscriptğ‘˜ğ’¦subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜subscriptâˆ‡ğ’˜subscriptğ¹ğ‘˜superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œ0\displaystyle\sum_{k\in\mathcal{K}}p_{k}\nabla_{\boldsymbol{w}}F_{k}(\boldsymbol{w}^{o})=\boldsymbol{0}. (63)

Since ğ”¼â€‹[Fkâ€‹(ğ’˜)]=Ekâ€‹(ğ’˜)ğ”¼delimited-[]subscriptğ¹ğ‘˜ğ’˜subscriptğ¸ğ‘˜ğ’˜\mathbb{E}[F_{k}(\boldsymbol{w})]={E}_{k}(\boldsymbol{w}) for all ğ’˜ğ’˜\boldsymbol{w}, it follows that

ğ”¼â€‹[âˆ‡ğ’˜Fkâ€‹(ğ’˜o)]=âˆ‡ğ’˜Ekâ€‹(ğ’˜o),âˆ€kâˆˆğ’¦.formulae-sequenceğ”¼delimited-[]subscriptâˆ‡ğ’˜subscriptğ¹ğ‘˜superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œsubscriptâˆ‡ğ’˜subscriptğ¸ğ‘˜superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œfor-allğ‘˜ğ’¦\displaystyle\mathbb{E}[\nabla_{\boldsymbol{w}}F_{k}(\boldsymbol{w}^{o})]=\nabla_{\boldsymbol{w}}{E}_{k}(\boldsymbol{w}^{o}),~{}\forall k\in\mathcal{K}. (64)

Let wlsubscriptğ‘¤ğ‘™{w}_{l} be the lğ‘™l-th entry of ğ’˜ğ’˜\boldsymbol{w}. Recall that Lf=max(ğ’™,y)âˆˆğ’Ÿâˆ¥âˆ‡ğ’˜â„“(ğ’˜o,ğ’™,y)âˆ¥2L_{f}=\max_{(\boldsymbol{x},y)\in\mathcal{D}}\left\lVert\nabla_{\boldsymbol{w}}\ell(\boldsymbol{w}^{o},\boldsymbol{x},y)\right\rVert_{2}. For a given lğ‘™l, we have

Prâ€‹(|âˆ‚Fâ€‹(ğ’˜o)âˆ‚wlâˆ’âˆ‚Eâ€‹(ğ’˜o)âˆ‚wl|>Ïµ)Prğ¹superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œsubscriptğ‘¤ğ‘™ğ¸superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œsubscriptğ‘¤ğ‘™italic-Ïµ\displaystyle~{}~{}~{}{\rm Pr}\left(\left|\frac{\partial F(\boldsymbol{w}^{o})}{\partial w_{l}}-\frac{\partial E(\boldsymbol{w}^{o})}{\partial w_{l}}\right|>\epsilon\right)
=Prâ€‹(|âˆ‚Eâ€‹(ğ’˜o)âˆ‚wl|>Ïµ)absentPrğ¸superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œsubscriptğ‘¤ğ‘™italic-Ïµ\displaystyle={\rm Pr}\left(\left|\frac{\partial E(\boldsymbol{w}^{o})}{\partial w_{l}}\right|>\epsilon\right)
â‰¤2â€‹expâ¡(âˆ’2â€‹Ïµ2Lf2â€‹âˆ‘kâˆˆğ’¦pk2/nk).absent22superscriptitalic-Ïµ2superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘“2subscriptğ‘˜ğ’¦superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘˜2subscriptğ‘›ğ‘˜\displaystyle\leq 2\exp\left(\frac{-2\epsilon^{2}}{L_{f}^{2}\sum_{k\in\mathcal{K}}p_{k}^{2}/n_{k}}\right). (65)

it follows that

Pr(âˆƒlâˆˆ{1,â€¦,d}s.t.|âˆ‚Eâ€‹(ğ’˜o)âˆ‚wl|>Ïµ)\displaystyle{\rm Pr}\left(\exists l\in\{1,...,d\}~{}{\rm s.t.}~{}\left|\frac{\partial E(\boldsymbol{w}^{o})}{\partial w_{l}}\right|>\epsilon\right)
=\displaystyle=~{} Prâ€‹((|âˆ‚Eâ€‹(ğ’˜o)âˆ‚w1|>Ïµ)âˆªâ€¦âˆª(|âˆ‚Eâ€‹(ğ’˜o)âˆ‚wd|>Ïµ))Prğ¸superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œsubscriptğ‘¤1italic-Ïµâ€¦ğ¸superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œsubscriptğ‘¤ğ‘‘italic-Ïµ\displaystyle{\rm Pr}\left(\left(\left|\frac{\partial E(\boldsymbol{w}^{o})}{\partial w_{1}}\right|>\epsilon\right)\cup...\cup\left(\left|\frac{\partial E(\boldsymbol{w}^{o})}{\partial w_{d}}\right|>\epsilon\right)\right)
â‰¤\displaystyle\leq~{} âˆ‘l=1dPrâ€‹(|âˆ‚Eâ€‹(ğ’˜o)âˆ‚wl|>Ïµ)superscriptsubscriptğ‘™1ğ‘‘Prğ¸superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œsubscriptğ‘¤ğ‘™italic-Ïµ\displaystyle\sum_{l=1}^{d}{\rm Pr}\left(\left|\frac{\partial E(\boldsymbol{w}^{o})}{\partial w_{l}}\right|>\epsilon\right)
â‰¤\displaystyle\leq~{} 2â€‹dâ€‹expâ¡(âˆ’2â€‹Ïµ2Lâ„“2â€‹âˆ‘kâˆˆğ’¦pk2/nk).2ğ‘‘2superscriptitalic-Ïµ2superscriptsubscriptğ¿â„“2subscriptğ‘˜ğ’¦superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘˜2subscriptğ‘›ğ‘˜\displaystyle 2d\exp\left(\frac{-2\epsilon^{2}}{L_{\ell}^{2}\sum_{k\in\mathcal{K}}p_{k}^{2}/n_{k}}\right). (66)

By setting Î´=2â€‹dâ€‹expâ¡(âˆ’2â€‹Ïµ2Lâ„“2â€‹âˆ‘kâˆˆğ’¦pk2/nk)ğ›¿2ğ‘‘2superscriptitalic-Ïµ2superscriptsubscriptğ¿â„“2subscriptğ‘˜ğ’¦superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘˜2subscriptğ‘›ğ‘˜\delta=2d\exp\left(\frac{-2\epsilon^{2}}{L_{\ell}^{2}\sum_{k\in\mathcal{K}}p_{k}^{2}/n_{k}}\right), we have that, with a probability of 1âˆ’Î´1ğ›¿1-\delta, the following inequality holds:

âˆ’âˆ‘kâˆˆğ’¦pk2nkâ€‹Lf2â€‹logâ¡(2â€‹d/Î´)2â€‹ğŸâª¯precedes-or-equalssubscriptğ‘˜ğ’¦superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘˜2subscriptğ‘›ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘“22ğ‘‘ğ›¿21absent\displaystyle-\sqrt{\sum_{k\in\mathcal{K}}\frac{p_{k}^{2}}{n_{k}}\frac{L_{f}^{2}\log(2d/\delta)}{2}}\boldsymbol{1}\preceq âˆ‡ğ’˜Ekâ€‹(ğ’˜o)subscriptâˆ‡ğ’˜subscriptğ¸ğ‘˜superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œ\displaystyle\nabla_{\boldsymbol{w}}{E}_{k}(\boldsymbol{w}^{o})
âª¯precedes-or-equals\displaystyle\preceq âˆ‘kâˆˆğ’¦pk2nkâ€‹Lf2â€‹logâ¡(2â€‹d/Î´)2â€‹ğŸsubscriptğ‘˜ğ’¦superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘˜2subscriptğ‘›ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘“22ğ‘‘ğ›¿21\displaystyle\sqrt{\sum_{k\in\mathcal{K}}\frac{p_{k}^{2}}{n_{k}}\frac{L_{f}^{2}\log(2d/\delta)}{2}}\boldsymbol{1}
â‡”âˆ¥âˆ‡ğ’˜Eâ€‹(ğ’˜o)âˆ¥22â‰¤iffsuperscriptsubscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ’˜ğ¸superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œ22absent\displaystyle\iff\quad\left\lVert\nabla_{\boldsymbol{w}}{E}(\boldsymbol{w}^{o})\right\rVert_{2}^{2}\leq âˆ‘kâˆˆğ’¦pk2nkâ€‹Lf2â€‹dâ€‹logâ¡(2â€‹d/Î´)2,subscriptğ‘˜ğ’¦superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘˜2subscriptğ‘›ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘“2ğ‘‘2ğ‘‘ğ›¿2\displaystyle\sum_{k\in\mathcal{K}}\frac{p_{k}^{2}}{n_{k}}\frac{L_{f}^{2}d\log(2d/\delta)}{2}, (67)

where ğŸ1\boldsymbol{1} denotes an all-ones vector. By strict convexity of Eâ€‹(ğ’˜)ğ¸ğ’˜E(\boldsymbol{w}), we have that, with a probability of 1âˆ’Î´1ğ›¿1-\delta, the following inequality holds:

Eâ€‹(ğ’˜o)âˆ’minğ’˜â¡Eâ€‹(ğ’˜)â‰¤ğ¸superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œsubscriptğ’˜ğ¸ğ’˜absent\displaystyle E(\boldsymbol{w}^{o})-\min_{\boldsymbol{w}}E(\boldsymbol{w})\leq 12â€‹Î¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡wEâ€‹(ğ’˜o)âˆ¥2212ğœ‡superscriptsubscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘¤ğ¸superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œ22\displaystyle\frac{1}{2\mu}\left\lVert\nabla_{w}E(\boldsymbol{w}^{o})\right\rVert_{2}^{2}
â‰¤\displaystyle\leq âˆ‘kâˆˆğ’¦pk2nkâ€‹Lf2â€‹dâ€‹logâ¡(2â€‹d/Î´)4â€‹Î¼.subscriptğ‘˜ğ’¦superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘˜2subscriptğ‘›ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘“2ğ‘‘2ğ‘‘ğ›¿4ğœ‡\displaystyle\sum_{k\in\mathcal{K}}\frac{p_{k}^{2}}{n_{k}}\frac{L_{f}^{2}d\log(2d/\delta)}{4\mu}. (68)

We complete the proof of Proposition 1. By replacing ğ’˜osuperscriptğ’˜ğ‘œ\boldsymbol{w}^{o} by ğ’˜kLsubscriptsuperscriptğ’˜ğ¿ğ‘˜\boldsymbol{w}^{L}_{k} and Eâ€‹(â‹…)ğ¸â‹…{E}(\cdot) by Ekâ€‹(â‹…)subscriptğ¸ğ‘˜â‹…{E}_{k}(\cdot) and setting pk=1subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜1p_{k}=1 and pj=0subscriptğ‘ğ‘—0p_{j}=0 for all jâ‰ kğ‘—ğ‘˜j\neq k, we also complete the proof of Corollary 1.

IX-B Proof of Proposition 2

Define Î»âˆˆ[0,1]ğœ†01\lambda\in[0,1] and E~â€‹(ğ’˜,Î»)~ğ¸ğ’˜ğœ†\tilde{E}(\boldsymbol{w},\lambda) such that

E~kâ€‹(ğ’˜,Î»)=(1âˆ’Î»)â€‹âˆ‘jâˆˆğ’¦pjâ€‹Ejâ€‹(ğ’˜)+Î»â€‹Ekâ€‹(ğ’˜).subscript~ğ¸ğ‘˜ğ’˜ğœ†1ğœ†subscriptğ‘—ğ’¦subscriptğ‘ğ‘—subscriptğ¸ğ‘—ğ’˜ğœ†subscriptğ¸ğ‘˜ğ’˜\displaystyle\tilde{E}_{k}(\boldsymbol{w},\lambda)=(1-\lambda)\sum_{j\in\mathcal{K}}p_{j}E_{j}(\boldsymbol{w})+\lambda E_{k}(\boldsymbol{w}). (69)

We have E~kâ€‹(ğ’˜,1)=Ekâ€‹(ğ’˜)subscript~ğ¸ğ‘˜ğ’˜1subscriptğ¸ğ‘˜ğ’˜\tilde{E}_{k}(\boldsymbol{w},1)=E_{k}(\boldsymbol{w}) and E~kâ€‹(ğ’˜,0)=Eâ€‹(ğ’˜)subscript~ğ¸ğ‘˜ğ’˜0ğ¸ğ’˜\tilde{E}_{k}(\boldsymbol{w},0)=E(\boldsymbol{w}) for all ğ’˜ğ’˜\boldsymbol{w}. Define

ğ’˜kâˆ—â€‹(Î»)superscriptsubscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜ğœ†\displaystyle\boldsymbol{w}_{k}^{*}(\lambda) â‰œargâ¡minğ’˜â¡E~kâ€‹(ğ’˜,Î»),âˆ€kâˆˆğ’¦,formulae-sequenceâ‰œabsentsubscriptğ’˜subscript~ğ¸ğ‘˜ğ’˜ğœ†for-allğ‘˜ğ’¦\displaystyle\triangleq\arg\min_{\boldsymbol{w}}\tilde{E}_{k}(\boldsymbol{w},\lambda),~{}\forall k\in\mathcal{K}, (70)
Vkâ€‹(Î»)subscriptğ‘‰ğ‘˜ğœ†\displaystyle V_{k}(\lambda) â‰œminğ’˜â¡E~kâ€‹(ğ’˜,Î»),âˆ€kâˆˆğ’¦.formulae-sequenceâ‰œabsentsubscriptğ’˜subscript~ğ¸ğ‘˜ğ’˜ğœ†for-allğ‘˜ğ’¦\displaystyle\triangleq\min_{\boldsymbol{w}}\tilde{E}_{k}(\boldsymbol{w},\lambda),~{}\forall k\in\mathcal{K}. (71)

By the envelope theorem [48],

âˆ‚Vkâ€‹(Î»)âˆ‚Î»=subscriptğ‘‰ğ‘˜ğœ†ğœ†absent\displaystyle\frac{\partial V_{k}(\lambda)}{\partial\lambda}= âˆ‚E~kâ€‹(ğ’˜kâˆ—â€‹(Î»),Î»)âˆ‚Î»subscript~ğ¸ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜ğœ†ğœ†ğœ†\displaystyle\frac{\partial\tilde{E}_{k}(\boldsymbol{w}_{k}^{*}(\lambda),\lambda)}{\partial\lambda}
=\displaystyle= âˆ«â„“â€‹(ğ’˜kâˆ—â€‹(Î»))â€‹ğ‘‘Pkâˆ’âˆ‘jâˆˆğ’¦âˆ«â„“â€‹(ğ’˜kâˆ—â€‹(Î»))â€‹pjâ€‹ğ‘‘Pj.â„“subscriptsuperscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜ğœ†differential-dsubscriptğ‘ƒğ‘˜subscriptğ‘—ğ’¦â„“subscriptsuperscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜ğœ†subscriptğ‘ğ‘—differential-dsubscriptğ‘ƒğ‘—\displaystyle\int\ell(\boldsymbol{w}^{*}_{k}(\lambda))dP_{k}-\sum_{j\in\mathcal{K}}\int\ell(\boldsymbol{w}^{*}_{k}(\lambda))p_{j}dP_{j}. (72)

Therefore, we have

|minğ’˜â¡Eâ€‹(ğ’˜)âˆ’minğ’˜â¡Ekâ€‹(ğ’˜)|subscriptğ’˜ğ¸ğ’˜subscriptğ’˜subscriptğ¸ğ‘˜ğ’˜\displaystyle\left|\min_{\boldsymbol{w}}E(\boldsymbol{w})-\min_{\boldsymbol{w}}E_{k}(\boldsymbol{w})\right|
=\displaystyle= |âˆ«01âˆ‚E~kâ€‹(ğ’˜kâˆ—â€‹(Î»),Î»)âˆ‚Î»â€‹ğ‘‘Î»|superscriptsubscript01subscript~ğ¸ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜ğœ†ğœ†ğœ†differential-dğœ†\displaystyle\left|\int_{0}^{1}\frac{\partial\tilde{E}_{k}(\boldsymbol{w}_{k}^{*}(\lambda),\lambda)}{\partial\lambda}d\lambda\right|
=\displaystyle= |âˆ«01âˆ«â„“â€‹(ğ’˜kâˆ—â€‹(Î»))â€‹(dâ€‹Pkâˆ’âˆ‘jâˆˆğ’¦pjâ€‹dâ€‹Pj)â€‹ğ‘‘Î»|superscriptsubscript01â„“subscriptsuperscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜ğœ†ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘ƒğ‘˜subscriptğ‘—ğ’¦subscriptğ‘ğ‘—ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘ƒğ‘—differential-dğœ†\displaystyle\left|\int_{0}^{1}\int\ell(\boldsymbol{w}^{*}_{k}(\lambda))\left(dP_{k}-\sum_{j\in\mathcal{K}}p_{j}dP_{j}\right)d\lambda\right|
â‰¤\displaystyle\leq âˆ«01|âˆ«â„“â€‹(ğ’˜kâˆ—â€‹(Î»))â€‹(dâ€‹Pkâˆ’âˆ‘jâˆˆğ’¦pjâ€‹dâ€‹Pj)|â€‹ğ‘‘Î»superscriptsubscript01â„“subscriptsuperscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜ğœ†ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘ƒğ‘˜subscriptğ‘—ğ’¦subscriptğ‘ğ‘—ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘ƒğ‘—differential-dğœ†\displaystyle\int_{0}^{1}\left|\int\ell(\boldsymbol{w}^{*}_{k}(\lambda))\left(dP_{k}-\sum_{j\in\mathcal{K}}p_{j}dP_{j}\right)\right|d\lambda
â‰¤\displaystyle\leq âˆ¥Pkâ€‹(â‹…)âˆ’âˆ‘jâˆˆğ’¦pjâ€‹Pjâ€‹(â‹…)âˆ¥.delimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptğ‘ƒğ‘˜â‹…subscriptğ‘—ğ’¦subscriptğ‘ğ‘—subscriptğ‘ƒğ‘—â‹…\displaystyle\left\lVert P_{k}(\cdot)-\sum_{j\in\mathcal{K}}p_{j}P_{j}(\cdot)\right\rVert. (73)

In addition, we have

|Eâ€‹(ğ’˜o)âˆ’Ekâ€‹(ğ’˜o)|=ğ¸superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œsubscriptğ¸ğ‘˜superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œabsent\displaystyle|E(\boldsymbol{w}^{o})-E_{k}(\boldsymbol{w}^{o})|= |âˆ«â„“â€‹(ğ’˜o)â€‹ğ‘‘Pkâˆ’âˆ‘jâˆˆğ’¦pjâ€‹âˆ«â„“â€‹(ğ’˜o)â€‹ğ‘‘Pj|â„“superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œdifferential-dsubscriptğ‘ƒğ‘˜subscriptğ‘—ğ’¦subscriptğ‘ğ‘—â„“superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œdifferential-dsubscriptğ‘ƒğ‘—\displaystyle\left|\int\ell(\boldsymbol{w}^{o})dP_{k}-\sum_{j\in\mathcal{K}}p_{j}\int\ell(\boldsymbol{w}^{o})dP_{j}\right|
â‰¤\displaystyle\leq âˆ¥Pkâ€‹(â‹…)âˆ’âˆ‘jâˆˆğ’¦pjâ€‹Pjâ€‹(â‹…)âˆ¥.delimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptğ‘ƒğ‘˜â‹…subscriptğ‘—ğ’¦subscriptğ‘ğ‘—subscriptğ‘ƒğ‘—â‹…\displaystyle\left\lVert P_{k}(\cdot)-\sum_{j\in\mathcal{K}}p_{j}P_{j}(\cdot)\right\rVert. (74)

Combining (73), (74), and Proposition 1, we complete the proof of Proposition 2.

IX-C Proof of Proposition 3

The problem in (15) is equivalent to

minğ’˜â€‹âˆ‘kâˆˆğ’¦p~kâ€‹Fkâ€‹(ğ’˜),subscriptğ’˜subscriptğ‘˜ğ’¦subscript~ğ‘ğ‘˜subscriptğ¹ğ‘˜ğ’˜\displaystyle\min_{\boldsymbol{w}}\sum_{k\in\mathcal{K}}\tilde{p}_{k}F_{k}(\boldsymbol{w}), (75)

where p~k=Î²â€‹pk1+(Î²âˆ’1)â€‹pksubscript~ğ‘ğ‘˜ğ›½subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜1ğ›½1subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜\tilde{p}_{k}=\frac{\beta p_{k}}{1+(\beta-1)p_{k}} and p~j=pj1+(Î²âˆ’1)â€‹pksubscript~ğ‘ğ‘—subscriptğ‘ğ‘—1ğ›½1subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜\tilde{p}_{j}=\frac{p_{j}}{1+(\beta-1)p_{k}}. Since (75) is similar to the FL problem in (3), replacing pksubscriptğ‘ğ‘˜p_{k} by p~ksubscript~ğ‘ğ‘˜\tilde{p}_{k} for all kâˆˆğ’¦ğ‘˜ğ’¦k\in\mathcal{K} in Proposition 2 proves Proposition 3.

IX-D Proof of Proposition 4

From Lemma 1, we have that

12â€‹Lgâ€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡Fâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ—)âˆ¥22â‰¤12subscriptğ¿ğ‘”superscriptsubscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥âˆ‡ğ¹superscriptğ’˜22absent\displaystyle\frac{1}{2L_{g}}\left\lVert\nabla F(\boldsymbol{w}^{*})\right\rVert_{2}^{2}\leq Fâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ—)âˆ’Fâ€‹(ğ’˜o)ğ¹superscriptğ’˜ğ¹superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œ\displaystyle~{}F(\boldsymbol{w}^{*})-F(\boldsymbol{w}^{o})
â‰¤\displaystyle\leq (1âˆ’Î¼Lg)T1â€‹(Fâ€‹(ğ’˜â€‹[0])âˆ’Fâ€‹(ğ’˜o)).superscript1ğœ‡subscriptğ¿ğ‘”subscriptğ‘‡1ğ¹ğ’˜delimited-[]0ğ¹superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œ\displaystyle\left(1-\frac{\mu}{L_{g}}\right)^{T_{1}}(F(\boldsymbol{w}[0])-F(\boldsymbol{w}^{o})). (76)

As in the proof of Proposition 1, we have

Prâ€‹(|âˆ‚Fâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ—)âˆ‚wlâˆ’âˆ‚Eâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ—)âˆ‚wl|>Ïµ)â‰¤2â€‹expâ¡(âˆ’2â€‹Ïµ2Lâ„“2â€‹âˆ‘kâˆˆğ’¦pk2/nk),Prğ¹superscriptğ’˜subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘™ğ¸superscriptğ’˜subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘™italic-Ïµ22superscriptitalic-Ïµ2superscriptsubscriptğ¿â„“2subscriptğ‘˜ğ’¦superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘˜2subscriptğ‘›ğ‘˜\displaystyle{\rm Pr}\left(\left|\frac{\partial F(\boldsymbol{w}^{*})}{\partial w_{l}}-\frac{\partial E(\boldsymbol{w}^{*})}{\partial w_{l}}\right|>\epsilon\right)\leq 2\exp\left(\frac{-2\epsilon^{2}}{L_{\ell}^{2}\sum_{k\in\mathcal{K}}p_{k}^{2}/n_{k}}\right), (77)

based on which we can prove Proposition 4.

By setting Î´=2â€‹dâ€‹expâ¡(âˆ’2â€‹Ïµ2âˆ‘kâˆˆğ’¦pk2/nk)ğ›¿2ğ‘‘2superscriptitalic-Ïµ2subscriptğ‘˜ğ’¦superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘˜2subscriptğ‘›ğ‘˜\delta=2d\exp\left(\frac{-2\epsilon^{2}}{\sum_{k\in\mathcal{K}}p_{k}^{2}/n_{k}}\right), we have that, with a probability of 1âˆ’Î´1ğ›¿1-\delta, the following inequality holds:

âˆ‘kâˆˆğ’¦pk2nkâ€‹Lg2â€‹logâ¡(2â€‹d/Î´)2â€‹ğŸsubscriptğ‘˜ğ’¦superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘˜2subscriptğ‘›ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘”22ğ‘‘ğ›¿21\displaystyle\sqrt{\sum_{k\in\mathcal{K}}\frac{p_{k}^{2}}{n_{k}}\frac{L_{g}^{2}\log(2d/\delta)}{2}}\boldsymbol{1} âª¯âˆ‡ğ’˜Eâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ—)âˆ’âˆ‡ğ’˜Fâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ—)precedes-or-equalsabsentsubscriptâˆ‡ğ’˜ğ¸superscriptğ’˜subscriptâˆ‡ğ’˜ğ¹superscriptğ’˜\displaystyle\preceq\nabla_{\boldsymbol{w}}{E}(\boldsymbol{w}^{*})-\nabla_{\boldsymbol{w}}{F}(\boldsymbol{w}^{*})
âª¯âˆ‘kâˆˆğ’¦pk2nkâ€‹Lâ„“2â€‹logâ¡(2â€‹d/Î´)2â€‹ğŸ.precedes-or-equalsabsentsubscriptğ‘˜ğ’¦superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘˜2subscriptğ‘›ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ¿â„“22ğ‘‘ğ›¿21\displaystyle\preceq\sqrt{\sum_{k\in\mathcal{K}}\frac{p_{k}^{2}}{n_{k}}\frac{L_{\ell}^{2}\log(2d/\delta)}{2}}\boldsymbol{1}. (78)

We have

âˆ¥âˆ‡ğ’˜Eâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ—)âˆ¥22superscriptsubscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ’˜ğ¸superscriptğ’˜22\displaystyle~{}~{}\left\lVert\nabla_{\boldsymbol{w}}{E}(\boldsymbol{w}^{*})\right\rVert_{2}^{2}
â‰¤(a)â€‹âˆ‘kâˆˆğ’¦pk2nkâ€‹Lâ„“2â€‹dâ€‹logâ¡(2â€‹d/Î´)+2â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡ğ’˜Fâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ—)âˆ¥22ğ‘subscriptğ‘˜ğ’¦superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘˜2subscriptğ‘›ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ¿â„“2ğ‘‘2ğ‘‘ğ›¿2superscriptsubscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ’˜ğ¹superscriptğ’˜22\displaystyle\overset{(a)}{\leq}\sum_{k\in\mathcal{K}}\frac{p_{k}^{2}}{n_{k}}L_{\ell}^{2}d\log(2d/\delta)+2\left\lVert\nabla_{\boldsymbol{w}}{F}(\boldsymbol{w}^{*})\right\rVert_{2}^{2}
â‰¤(b)â€‹âˆ‘kâˆˆğ’¦pk2nkâ€‹Lâ„“2â€‹dâ€‹logâ¡(2â€‹d/Î´),ğ‘subscriptğ‘˜ğ’¦superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘˜2subscriptğ‘›ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ¿â„“2ğ‘‘2ğ‘‘ğ›¿\displaystyle\overset{(b)}{\leq}\sum_{k\in\mathcal{K}}\frac{p_{k}^{2}}{n_{k}}L_{\ell}^{2}d\log(2d/\delta),
+4â€‹Lgâ€‹(1âˆ’Î¼Lg)T1â€‹(Fâ€‹(ğ’˜â€‹[0])âˆ’Fâ€‹(ğ’˜o)),4subscriptğ¿ğ‘”superscript1ğœ‡subscriptğ¿ğ‘”subscriptğ‘‡1ğ¹ğ’˜delimited-[]0ğ¹superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œ\displaystyle~{}~{}~{}+4L_{g}\left(1-\frac{\mu}{L_{g}}\right)^{T_{1}}(F(\boldsymbol{w}[0])-F(\boldsymbol{w}^{o})), (79)

where (a)ğ‘(a) results from âˆ¥ğ’™+ğ’šâˆ¥2â‰¤âˆ¥ğ’™+ğ’šâˆ¥2+âˆ¥ğ’™âˆ’ğ’šâˆ¥2=2â€‹âˆ¥ğ’™âˆ¥2+2â€‹âˆ¥ğ’šâˆ¥2superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥ğ’™ğ’š2superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥ğ’™ğ’š2superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥ğ’™ğ’š22superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥ğ’™22superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥ğ’š2\left\lVert\boldsymbol{x}+\boldsymbol{y}\right\rVert^{2}\leq\left\lVert\boldsymbol{x}+\boldsymbol{y}\right\rVert^{2}+\left\lVert\boldsymbol{x}-\boldsymbol{y}\right\rVert^{2}=2\left\lVert\boldsymbol{x}\right\rVert^{2}+2\left\lVert\boldsymbol{y}\right\rVert^{2} for any two vectors, and (b)ğ‘(b) is from (76). By strict convexity of Eâ€‹(ğ’˜)ğ¸ğ’˜E(\boldsymbol{w}), we have that, with a probability of 1âˆ’Î´1ğ›¿1-\delta, the following inequality holds:

Eâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ—)âˆ’minğ’˜â¡Eâ€‹(ğ’˜)ğ¸superscriptğ’˜subscriptğ’˜ğ¸ğ’˜\displaystyle E(\boldsymbol{w}^{*})-\min_{\boldsymbol{w}}E(\boldsymbol{w}) â‰¤12â€‹Î¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡wEâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ—)âˆ¥22absent12ğœ‡superscriptsubscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptâˆ‡ğ‘¤ğ¸superscriptğ’˜22\displaystyle\leq\frac{1}{2\mu}\left\lVert\nabla_{w}E(\boldsymbol{w}^{*})\right\rVert_{2}^{2}
â‰¤âˆ‘kâˆˆğ’¦pk2nkâ€‹Lâ„“2â€‹dâ€‹logâ¡(2â€‹d/Î´)2â€‹Î¼absentsubscriptğ‘˜ğ’¦superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘˜2subscriptğ‘›ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ¿â„“2ğ‘‘2ğ‘‘ğ›¿2ğœ‡\displaystyle\leq\sum_{k\in\mathcal{K}}\frac{p_{k}^{2}}{n_{k}}\frac{L_{\ell}^{2}d\log(2d/\delta)}{2\mu}
+2â€‹LgÎ¼â€‹(1âˆ’Î¼Lg)T1â€‹(Fâ€‹(ğ’˜â€‹[0])âˆ’Fâ€‹(ğ’˜o)).2subscriptğ¿ğ‘”ğœ‡superscript1ğœ‡subscriptğ¿ğ‘”subscriptğ‘‡1ğ¹ğ’˜delimited-[]0ğ¹superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œ\displaystyle~{}~{}+\frac{2L_{g}}{\mu}\left(1-\frac{\mu}{L_{g}}\right)^{T_{1}}(F(\boldsymbol{w}[0])-F(\boldsymbol{w}^{o})). (80)

IX-E Proof of Proposition 5

In this proof, we introduce the following definitions:

Î”â€‹ğ’˜âˆ’kâ€‹[t]â‰œâ‰œÎ”subscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡absent\displaystyle\Delta\boldsymbol{w}_{-k}[t]\triangleq ğ’˜âˆ’kâ€‹[t+1]âˆ’ğ’˜âˆ’kâ€‹[t]subscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡1subscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡\displaystyle~{}\boldsymbol{w}_{-k}[t+1]-\boldsymbol{w}_{-k}[t]
=\displaystyle= Î·2â€‹âˆ‘jâ‰ kâˆ‡Fjâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ’kâ€‹[t]),âˆ€kâˆˆğ’¦,tâˆˆ{0,1,â€¦,T2},formulae-sequencesubscriptğœ‚2subscriptğ‘—ğ‘˜âˆ‡subscriptğ¹ğ‘—subscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡for-allğ‘˜ğ’¦ğ‘¡01â€¦subscriptğ‘‡2\displaystyle~{}\eta_{2}\sum_{j\neq k}\nabla F_{j}(\boldsymbol{w}_{-k}[t]),~{}\forall k\in\mathcal{K},t\in\{0,1,...,T_{2}\}, (81)
ğ‘®âˆ’kâ€‹(ğ’˜)â‰œâˆ‘jâ‰ kpjpkâ€‹âˆ‡Fjâ€‹(ğ’˜)â‰¤1âˆ’pkpkâ€‹Lf,âˆ€kâˆˆğ’¦,formulae-sequenceâ‰œsubscriptğ‘®ğ‘˜ğ’˜subscriptğ‘—ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘ğ‘—subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜âˆ‡subscriptğ¹ğ‘—ğ’˜1subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜subscriptğ¿ğ‘“for-allğ‘˜ğ’¦\displaystyle\boldsymbol{G}_{-k}(\boldsymbol{w})\triangleq\sum_{j\neq k}\frac{p_{j}}{p_{k}}\nabla{F}_{j}(\boldsymbol{w})\leq\frac{1-p_{k}}{p_{k}}L_{f},~{}\forall k\in\mathcal{K}, (82)

and

gk,tâ€‹(x)=subscriptğ‘”ğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ‘¥absent\displaystyle g_{k,t}(x)= xâ€‹ğ‘®âˆ’kâ€‹(ğ’˜â€‹[t])Tâ€‹Î”â€‹ğ’˜â€‹[t]ğ‘¥subscriptğ‘®ğ‘˜superscriptğ’˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡ğ‘‡Î”ğ’˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡\displaystyle x\boldsymbol{G}_{-k}(\boldsymbol{w}[t])^{T}\Delta\boldsymbol{w}[t]
âˆ’âˆ«0xğ‘®âˆ’kâ€‹(ğ’˜â€‹[t]+zâ‹…Î”â€‹ğ’˜â€‹[t])Tâ€‹Î”â€‹ğ’˜â€‹[t]â€‹ğ‘‘z,superscriptsubscript0ğ‘¥subscriptğ‘®ğ‘˜superscriptğ’˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡â‹…ğ‘§Î”ğ’˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡ğ‘‡Î”ğ’˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡differential-dğ‘§\displaystyle-\int_{0}^{x}\boldsymbol{G}_{-k}(\boldsymbol{w}[t]+z\cdot\Delta\boldsymbol{w}[t])^{T}\Delta\boldsymbol{w}[t]dz, (83)

for all kâˆˆğ’¦,tâˆˆ{0,1,â€¦,T2}formulae-sequenceğ‘˜ğ’¦ğ‘¡01â€¦subscriptğ‘‡2k\in\mathcal{K},t\in\{0,1,...,T_{2}\}. It follows that

âˆ‚gk,tâˆ‚x=subscriptğ‘”ğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ‘¥absent\displaystyle\frac{\partial g_{k,t}}{\partial x}= ğ‘®âˆ’kâ€‹(ğ’˜â€‹[t])Tâ€‹Î”â€‹ğ’˜â€‹[t]âˆ’ğ‘®âˆ’kâ€‹(ğ’˜â€‹[t]+xâ‹…Î”â€‹ğ’˜â€‹[t])Tâ€‹Î”â€‹ğ’˜â€‹[t]subscriptğ‘®ğ‘˜superscriptğ’˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡ğ‘‡Î”ğ’˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘®ğ‘˜superscriptğ’˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡â‹…ğ‘¥Î”ğ’˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡ğ‘‡Î”ğ’˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡\displaystyle~{}\boldsymbol{G}_{-k}(\boldsymbol{w}[t])^{T}\Delta\boldsymbol{w}[t]-\boldsymbol{G}_{-k}(\boldsymbol{w}[t]+x\cdot\Delta\boldsymbol{w}[t])^{T}\Delta\boldsymbol{w}[t]
â‰¤\displaystyle\leq (ğ‘®âˆ’kâ€‹(ğ’˜â€‹[t])âˆ’ğ‘®âˆ’kâ€‹(ğ’˜â€‹[t]+xâ‹…Î”â€‹ğ’˜â€‹[t]))Tâ€‹Î”â€‹ğ’˜â€‹[t]superscriptsubscriptğ‘®ğ‘˜ğ’˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘®ğ‘˜ğ’˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡â‹…ğ‘¥Î”ğ’˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡ğ‘‡Î”ğ’˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡\displaystyle~{}(\boldsymbol{G}_{-k}(\boldsymbol{w}[t])-\boldsymbol{G}_{-k}(\boldsymbol{w}[t]+x\cdot\Delta\boldsymbol{w}[t]))^{T}\Delta\boldsymbol{w}[t]
â‰¤\displaystyle\leq 1âˆ’pkpkâ€‹Lgâ€‹xâ€‹âˆ¥Î”â€‹ğ’˜â€‹[t]âˆ¥22.1subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜subscriptğ¿ğ‘”ğ‘¥superscriptsubscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥Î”ğ’˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡22\displaystyle~{}\frac{1-p_{k}}{p_{k}}L_{g}x\left\lVert\Delta\boldsymbol{w}[t]\right\rVert_{2}^{2}. (84)

We have

âˆ‘t=1T2âˆ¥Î”â€‹ğ’˜â€‹[t]âˆ¥22superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡1subscriptğ‘‡2superscriptsubscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥Î”ğ’˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡22\displaystyle\sum_{t=1}^{T_{2}}\left\lVert\Delta\boldsymbol{w}[t]\right\rVert_{2}^{2} =âˆ‘t=1T2âˆ¥Î·2â€‹pkâ€‹ğ‘®âˆ’kâ€‹[t]âˆ¥22absentsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¡1subscriptğ‘‡2superscriptsubscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptğœ‚2subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘®ğ‘˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡22\displaystyle=\sum_{t=1}^{T_{2}}\left\lVert\eta_{2}p_{k}\boldsymbol{G}_{-k}[t]\right\rVert_{2}^{2}
â‰¤Lf2â€‹T2â€‹Î·22.absentsuperscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘“2subscriptğ‘‡2superscriptsubscriptğœ‚22\displaystyle\leq L_{f}^{2}T_{2}\eta_{2}^{2}. (85)

Collectively, we have

|ğ’«kâˆ—âˆ’âˆ‘jâ‰ kpjpkâ€‹[Fjâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ—)âˆ’Fjâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ’kâˆ—)]|superscriptsubscriptğ’«ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘—ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘ğ‘—subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜delimited-[]subscriptğ¹ğ‘—superscriptğ’˜subscriptğ¹ğ‘—superscriptsubscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜\displaystyle\left|\mathcal{P}_{k}^{*}-\sum_{j\neq k}\frac{p_{j}}{p_{k}}\left[F_{j}(\boldsymbol{w}^{*})-F_{j}(\boldsymbol{w}_{-k}^{*})\right]\right| â‰¤âˆ‘t=1Tgk,tâ€‹(1)absentsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¡1ğ‘‡subscriptğ‘”ğ‘˜ğ‘¡1\displaystyle\leq\sum_{t=1}^{T}g_{k,t}(1)
â‰¤1âˆ’pkpkâ€‹Lgâ€‹âˆ‘t=1T2âˆ¥Î”â€‹ğ’˜â€‹[t]âˆ¥22absent1subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜subscriptğ¿ğ‘”superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡1subscriptğ‘‡2superscriptsubscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥Î”ğ’˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡22\displaystyle\leq\frac{1-p_{k}}{p_{k}}L_{g}\sum_{t=1}^{T_{2}}\left\lVert\Delta\boldsymbol{w}[t]\right\rVert_{2}^{2}
â‰¤1âˆ’pkpkâ€‹Lgâ€‹Lf2â€‹T2â€‹Î·22,absent1subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜subscriptğ¿ğ‘”superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘“2subscriptğ‘‡2superscriptsubscriptğœ‚22\displaystyle\leq\frac{1-p_{k}}{p_{k}}L_{g}L_{f}^{2}T_{2}\eta_{2}^{2}, (86)

which completes the proof.

IX-F Proof of Lemma 2

Define ğ€={Î»k}kâˆˆğ’¦ğ€subscriptsubscriptğœ†ğ‘˜ğ‘˜ğ’¦\boldsymbol{\lambda}=\{\lambda_{k}\}_{k\in\mathcal{K}} and Î»kâˆˆ[0,1]subscriptğœ†ğ‘˜01\lambda_{k}\in[0,1]. Define a vector function

â„±â€‹(ğ’˜,ğ€)=âˆ‘kâˆˆğ’¦Î»kâ€‹pkâ€‹âˆ‡ğ’˜Fkâ€‹(ğ’˜).â„±ğ’˜ğ€subscriptğ‘˜ğ’¦subscriptğœ†ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜subscriptâˆ‡ğ’˜subscriptğ¹ğ‘˜ğ’˜\displaystyle\mathcal{F}(\boldsymbol{w},\boldsymbol{\lambda})=\sum_{k\in\mathcal{K}}\lambda_{k}p_{k}\nabla_{\boldsymbol{w}}F_{k}(\boldsymbol{w}). (87)

Define ğ’˜âˆ—â€‹(ğ€)superscriptğ’˜ğ€\boldsymbol{w}^{*}(\boldsymbol{\lambda}) to be the solution to the following implicit function:

â„±â€‹(ğ’˜,ğ€)=âˆ‘kâˆˆğ’¦Î»kâ€‹pkâ€‹âˆ‡ğ’˜Fkâ€‹(ğ’˜)=ğŸ,âˆ€Î»kâˆˆ[0,1].formulae-sequenceâ„±ğ’˜ğ€subscriptğ‘˜ğ’¦subscriptğœ†ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜subscriptâˆ‡ğ’˜subscriptğ¹ğ‘˜ğ’˜0for-allsubscriptğœ†ğ‘˜01\displaystyle\mathcal{F}(\boldsymbol{w},\boldsymbol{\lambda})=\sum_{k\in\mathcal{K}}\lambda_{k}p_{k}\nabla_{\boldsymbol{w}}F_{k}(\boldsymbol{w})=\boldsymbol{0},~{}\forall\lambda_{k}\in[0,1]. (88)

Note that ğ’˜âˆ’kâˆ—superscriptsubscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜\boldsymbol{w}_{-k}^{*} in (26) is the same as ğ’˜âˆ—â€‹(ğ€^)superscriptğ’˜^ğ€\boldsymbol{w}^{*}(\hat{\boldsymbol{\lambda}}) given ğ€^^ğ€\hat{\boldsymbol{\lambda}} such that Î»^k=0subscript^ğœ†ğ‘˜0\hat{\lambda}_{k}=0 and Î»^j=1subscript^ğœ†ğ‘—1\hat{\lambda}_{j}=1 for all jâ‰ kğ‘—ğ‘˜j\neq k. By the implicit function theorem, we have

[âˆ‚wkâˆ‚Î»j]k,j=âˆ’(âˆ‡ğ’˜â„±â€‹(ğ’˜,ğ€))âˆ’1â‹…âˆ‡ğ€â„±â€‹(ğ’˜,ğ€),subscriptdelimited-[]subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘˜subscriptğœ†ğ‘—ğ‘˜ğ‘—â‹…superscriptsubscriptâˆ‡ğ’˜â„±ğ’˜ğ€1subscriptâˆ‡ğ€â„±ğ’˜ğ€\displaystyle\left[\frac{\partial w_{k}}{\partial\lambda_{j}}\right]_{k,j}=-(\nabla_{\boldsymbol{w}}\mathcal{F}(\boldsymbol{w},\boldsymbol{\lambda}))^{-1}\cdot\nabla_{\boldsymbol{\lambda}}\mathcal{F}(\boldsymbol{w},\boldsymbol{\lambda}), (89)

where

âˆ‡ğ’˜â„±â€‹(ğ’˜,ğ€)=âˆ‘kâˆˆğ’¦Î»kâ€‹pkâ€‹âˆ‡ğ’˜2Fkâ€‹(ğ’˜),subscriptâˆ‡ğ’˜â„±ğ’˜ğ€subscriptğ‘˜ğ’¦subscriptğœ†ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜subscriptsuperscriptâˆ‡2ğ’˜subscriptğ¹ğ‘˜ğ’˜\displaystyle\nabla_{\boldsymbol{w}}\mathcal{F}(\boldsymbol{w},\boldsymbol{\lambda})=\sum_{k\in\mathcal{K}}\lambda_{k}p_{k}\nabla^{2}_{\boldsymbol{w}}F_{k}(\boldsymbol{w}), (90)

and

âˆ‡ğ€â„±â€‹(ğ’˜,ğ€)=(p1â€‹âˆ‡F1â€‹(ğ’˜)p2â€‹âˆ‡F2â€‹(ğ’˜)â‹¯pKâ€‹âˆ‡FKâ€‹(ğ’˜)).subscriptâˆ‡ğ€â„±ğ’˜ğ€matrixsubscriptğ‘1âˆ‡subscriptğ¹1ğ’˜subscriptğ‘2âˆ‡subscriptğ¹2ğ’˜â‹¯subscriptğ‘ğ¾âˆ‡subscriptğ¹ğ¾ğ’˜\displaystyle\nabla_{\boldsymbol{\lambda}}\mathcal{F}(\boldsymbol{w},\boldsymbol{\lambda})=\begin{pmatrix}p_{1}\nabla F_{1}(\boldsymbol{w})&p_{2}\nabla F_{2}(\boldsymbol{w})&\cdot\cdot\cdot&p_{K}\nabla F_{K}(\boldsymbol{w})\end{pmatrix}. (91)

Note that, Fkâ€‹(ğ’˜)subscriptğ¹ğ‘˜ğ’˜F_{k}(\boldsymbol{w}) is positive definite due to the strong convexity of Fkâ€‹(ğ’˜)subscriptğ¹ğ‘˜ğ’˜F_{k}(\boldsymbol{w}). Therefore, (âˆ‡ğ’˜â„±â€‹(ğ’˜,ğ€))âˆ’1superscriptsubscriptâˆ‡ğ’˜â„±ğ’˜ğ€1(\nabla_{\boldsymbol{w}}\mathcal{F}(\boldsymbol{w},\boldsymbol{\lambda}))^{-1} is well defined.

Equation (89) can be re-expressed as

âˆ‚ğ’˜âˆ—â€‹(ğ€)âˆ‚Î»k=âˆ’(âˆ‡ğ’˜â„±â€‹(ğ’˜,ğ€))âˆ’1â€‹pkâ€‹âˆ‡Fkâ€‹(ğ’˜),âˆ€kâˆˆğ’¦.formulae-sequencesuperscriptğ’˜ğ€subscriptğœ†ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptâˆ‡ğ’˜â„±ğ’˜ğ€1subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜âˆ‡subscriptğ¹ğ‘˜ğ’˜for-allğ‘˜ğ’¦\displaystyle\frac{\partial\boldsymbol{w}^{*}(\boldsymbol{\lambda})}{\partial\lambda_{k}}=-(\nabla_{\boldsymbol{w}}\mathcal{F}(\boldsymbol{w},\boldsymbol{\lambda}))^{-1}p_{k}\nabla F_{k}(\boldsymbol{w}),~{}\forall k\in\mathcal{K}. (92)

The distance between ğ’˜osuperscriptğ’˜ğ‘œ\boldsymbol{w}^{o} and ğ’˜âˆ’kâˆ—subscriptsuperscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜\boldsymbol{w}^{*}_{-k} is then bounded by, where Î»j=1subscriptğœ†ğ‘—1\lambda_{j}=1 for all jâ‰ kğ‘—ğ‘˜j\neq k and pk=1Ksubscriptğ‘ğ‘˜1ğ¾p_{k}=\frac{1}{K} for all kğ‘˜k,

âˆ¥ğ’˜oâˆ’ğ’˜âˆ’kâˆ—âˆ¥2subscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œsubscriptsuperscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜2\displaystyle~{}~{}\left\lVert\boldsymbol{w}^{o}-\boldsymbol{w}^{*}_{-k}\right\rVert_{2}
=âˆ¥âˆ«01âˆ‚ğ’˜âˆ—â€‹(ğ€)âˆ‚Î»kâ€‹ğ‘‘Î»kâˆ¥2absentsubscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscript01superscriptğ’˜ğ€subscriptğœ†ğ‘˜differential-dsubscriptğœ†ğ‘˜2\displaystyle=\left\lVert\int_{0}^{1}\frac{\partial\boldsymbol{w}^{*}(\boldsymbol{\lambda})}{\partial\lambda_{k}}d{\lambda_{k}}\right\rVert_{2}
â‰¤âˆ«01âˆ¥âˆ‚ğ’˜âˆ—â€‹(ğ€)âˆ‚Î»kâˆ¥2â€‹ğ‘‘Î»kabsentsuperscriptsubscript01subscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptğ’˜ğ€subscriptğœ†ğ‘˜2differential-dsubscriptğœ†ğ‘˜\displaystyle\leq\int_{0}^{1}\left\lVert\frac{\partial\boldsymbol{w}^{*}(\boldsymbol{\lambda})}{\partial\lambda_{k}}\right\rVert_{2}d{\lambda_{k}}
â‰¤âˆ«01âˆ¥(âˆ‘kâˆˆğ’¦âˆ‡ğ’˜2Fkâ€‹(ğ’˜,ğ€))âˆ’1â€‹âˆ‡Fkâ€‹(ğ’˜)âˆ¥2â€‹ğ‘‘Î»kabsentsuperscriptsubscript01subscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ’¦superscriptsubscriptâˆ‡ğ’˜2subscriptğ¹ğ‘˜ğ’˜ğ€1âˆ‡subscriptğ¹ğ‘˜ğ’˜2differential-dsubscriptğœ†ğ‘˜\displaystyle\leq\int_{0}^{1}\left\lVert\left(\sum_{k\in\mathcal{K}}\nabla_{\boldsymbol{w}}^{2}F_{k}(\boldsymbol{w},\boldsymbol{\lambda})\right)^{-1}\nabla F_{k}(\boldsymbol{w})\right\rVert_{2}d{\lambda_{k}}
â‰¤âˆ«01âˆ¥(âˆ‘kâˆˆğ’¦âˆ‡ğ’˜2Fkâ€‹(ğ’˜,ğ€))âˆ’1âˆ¥2â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡Fkâ€‹(ğ’˜)âˆ¥2â€‹ğ‘‘Î»kabsentsuperscriptsubscript01subscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ’¦superscriptsubscriptâˆ‡ğ’˜2subscriptğ¹ğ‘˜ğ’˜ğ€12subscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥âˆ‡subscriptğ¹ğ‘˜ğ’˜2differential-dsubscriptğœ†ğ‘˜\displaystyle\leq\int_{0}^{1}\left\lVert\left(\sum_{k\in\mathcal{K}}\nabla_{\boldsymbol{w}}^{2}F_{k}(\boldsymbol{w},\boldsymbol{\lambda})\right)^{-1}\right\rVert_{2}\left\lVert\nabla F_{k}(\boldsymbol{w})\right\rVert_{2}d{\lambda_{k}}
â‰¤(a)â€‹âˆ«01LfÎ¼â€‹Kâ€‹ğ‘‘Î»k=LfÎ¼â€‹K,ğ‘superscriptsubscript01subscriptğ¿ğ‘“ğœ‡ğ¾differential-dsubscriptğœ†ğ‘˜subscriptğ¿ğ‘“ğœ‡ğ¾\displaystyle\overset{(a)}{\leq}\int_{0}^{1}\frac{L_{f}}{\mu K}d{\lambda_{k}}=\frac{L_{f}}{\mu K}, (93)

where (a)ğ‘(a) is from Î¼ğœ‡\mu-strong convexity (Assumptions 1) and Definition 3.

IX-G Proof of Theorem 1

Lemma 3.

In Algorithm 1, the following inequality holds:

âˆ¥ğ’˜â€‹[t]âˆ’ğ’˜oâˆ¥22â‰¤(1âˆ’Î¼â€‹Î·)tâ€‹âˆ¥ğ’˜â€‹[0]âˆ’ğ’˜oâˆ¥22,âˆ€tâˆˆ{0,1,â€¦,T1}.formulae-sequencesuperscriptsubscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥ğ’˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œ22superscript1ğœ‡ğœ‚ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥ğ’˜delimited-[]0superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œ22for-allğ‘¡01â€¦subscriptğ‘‡1\displaystyle\left\lVert\boldsymbol{w}[t]-\boldsymbol{w}^{o}\right\rVert_{2}^{2}\leq(1-\mu\eta)^{t}\left\lVert\boldsymbol{w}[0]-\boldsymbol{w}^{o}\right\rVert_{2}^{2},\forall t\in\{0,1,...,T_{1}\}. (94)

From Lemma 3, we have that the distance between the exact solution and the output solution is âˆ¥ğ’˜oâˆ’ğ’˜âˆ—âˆ¥2â‰¤Gâ€‹(1âˆ’Î¼Lg)T1subscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œsuperscriptğ’˜2ğºsuperscript1ğœ‡subscriptğ¿ğ‘”subscriptğ‘‡1\left\lVert\boldsymbol{w}^{o}-\boldsymbol{w}^{*}\right\rVert_{2}\leq G\sqrt{\left(1-\frac{\mu}{L_{g}}\right)^{T_{1}}}, where Gâ‰œâˆ¥ğ’˜â€‹[0]âˆ’ğ’˜oâˆ¥2â‰œğºsubscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥ğ’˜delimited-[]0superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œ2G\triangleq\left\lVert\boldsymbol{w}[0]-\boldsymbol{w}^{o}\right\rVert_{2}. We set T1subscriptğ‘‡1T_{1} such that

Gâ€‹(1âˆ’Î¼Lg)T1â‰¤Î”K,ğºsuperscript1ğœ‡subscriptğ¿ğ‘”subscriptğ‘‡1Î”ğ¾\displaystyle G\sqrt{\left(1-\frac{\mu}{L_{g}}\right)^{T_{1}}}\leq\frac{\Delta}{K}, (95)

which is equivalent to

T1â‰¥2â€‹lnâ¡(Kâ€‹GÎ”)lnâ¡((1âˆ’Î¼Lg)âˆ’1).subscriptğ‘‡12ğ¾ğºÎ”superscript1ğœ‡subscriptğ¿ğ‘”1\displaystyle T_{1}\geq\frac{2\ln\left(\frac{KG}{\Delta}\right)}{\ln\left((1-\frac{\mu}{L_{g}})^{-1}\right)}. (96)

From Lemma 2, we have

âˆ¥ğ’˜âˆ’koâˆ’ğ’˜âˆ—âˆ¥22â‰¤superscriptsubscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜ğ‘œsuperscriptğ’˜22absent\displaystyle\left\lVert\boldsymbol{w}_{-k}^{o}-\boldsymbol{w}^{*}\right\rVert_{2}^{2}\leq (âˆ¥ğ’˜âˆ’koâˆ’ğ’˜oâˆ¥2+âˆ¥ğ’˜oâˆ’ğ’˜âˆ—âˆ¥2âŸSuboptimality in Phase I)2superscriptsubscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜ğ‘œsuperscriptğ’˜ğ‘œ2subscriptâŸsubscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œsuperscriptğ’˜2Suboptimality in Phase I2\displaystyle(\left\lVert\boldsymbol{w}_{-k}^{o}-\boldsymbol{w}^{o}\right\rVert_{2}+\underbrace{\left\lVert\boldsymbol{w}^{o}-\boldsymbol{w}^{*}\right\rVert_{2}}_{\text{Suboptimality in Phase I}})^{2}
â‰¤\displaystyle\leq (LfÎ¼â€‹K+Î”K)2,âˆ€kâˆˆğ’¦.superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘“ğœ‡ğ¾Î”ğ¾2for-allğ‘˜ğ’¦\displaystyle\left(\frac{L_{f}}{\mu K}+\frac{\Delta}{K}\right)^{2},\forall k\in\mathcal{K}. (97)

Based on a similar argument as in Lemma 3, we have

âˆ¥ğ’˜âˆ’kâ€‹[t]âˆ’ğ’˜âˆ’koâˆ¥22superscriptsubscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜ğ‘œ22\displaystyle\left\lVert\boldsymbol{w}_{-k}[t]-\boldsymbol{w}_{-k}^{o}\right\rVert_{2}^{2} â‰¤(1âˆ’Î¼Lg)tâ€‹âˆ¥ğ’˜âˆ—âˆ’ğ’˜âˆ’koâˆ¥22absentsuperscript1ğœ‡subscriptğ¿ğ‘”ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptğ’˜superscriptsubscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜ğ‘œ22\displaystyle\leq\left(1-\frac{\mu}{L_{g}}\right)^{t}\left\lVert\boldsymbol{w}^{*}-\boldsymbol{w}_{-k}^{o}\right\rVert_{2}^{2}
â‰¤(1âˆ’Î¼Lg)tâ€‹(LfÎ¼â€‹K+Î”K)2,âˆ€tâˆˆâ„•.formulae-sequenceabsentsuperscript1ğœ‡subscriptğ¿ğ‘”ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘“ğœ‡ğ¾Î”ğ¾2for-allğ‘¡â„•\displaystyle\leq\left(1-\frac{\mu}{L_{g}}\right)^{t}\left(\frac{L_{f}}{\mu K}+\frac{\Delta}{K}\right)^{2},~{}\forall t\in\mathbb{N}. (98)

By Lgsubscriptğ¿ğ‘”L_{g}-smoothness, we have

âˆ‘jâ‰ k(Fjâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ’kâ€‹[t])âˆ’Fjâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ’kâˆ—))â‰¤Lgâ€‹(Kâˆ’1)2â€‹âˆ¥ğ’˜âˆ’kâ€‹[t]âˆ’ğ’˜âˆ’kâˆ—âˆ¥22.subscriptğ‘—ğ‘˜subscriptğ¹ğ‘—subscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡subscriptğ¹ğ‘—superscriptsubscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜subscriptğ¿ğ‘”ğ¾12superscriptsubscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜22\sum_{j\neq k}\left(F_{j}(\boldsymbol{w}_{-k}[t])-F_{j}(\boldsymbol{w}_{-k}^{*})\right)\leq\frac{L_{g}(K-1)}{2}\left\lVert\boldsymbol{w}_{-k}[t]-\boldsymbol{w}_{-k}^{*}\right\rVert_{2}^{2}.

Combining (98) and Proposition 5, we have

|ğ’«kâ€‹[T2]âˆ’ğ’«kVCG|â‰¤subscriptğ’«ğ‘˜delimited-[]subscriptğ‘‡2superscriptsubscriptğ’«ğ‘˜VCGabsent\displaystyle|\mathcal{P}_{k}[T_{2}]-\mathcal{P}_{k}^{\rm VCG}|\leq Lgâ€‹(Kâˆ’1)2â€‹(1âˆ’Î¼Lg)T2â€‹(LfÎ¼â€‹K+Î”K)2subscriptğ¿ğ‘”ğ¾12superscript1ğœ‡subscriptğ¿ğ‘”subscriptğ‘‡2superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘“ğœ‡ğ¾Î”ğ¾2\displaystyle\frac{L_{g}(K-1)}{2}\left(1-\frac{\mu}{L_{g}}\right)^{T_{2}}\left(\frac{L_{f}}{\mu K}+\frac{\Delta}{K}\right)^{2}
+(Kâˆ’1)â€‹Lgâ€‹Lf2â€‹(âˆ‘t=1T2Î·2â€‹[t]+Î·2â€‹[1]).ğ¾1subscriptğ¿ğ‘”superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘“2superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡1subscriptğ‘‡2superscriptğœ‚2delimited-[]ğ‘¡superscriptğœ‚2delimited-[]1\displaystyle+(K-1)L_{g}L_{f}^{2}\left(\sum_{t=1}^{T_{2}}\eta^{2}[t]+\eta^{2}[1]\right). (99)

By selecting Î·2=1Kâ€‹Lgsubscriptğœ‚21ğ¾subscriptğ¿ğ‘”\eta_{2}=\frac{1}{KL_{g}} and

T2âˆˆ[lnâ¡((Lf+Î”â€‹Î¼)2â€‹LgÎ¼2â€‹Kâ€‹Ïµ)/lnâ¡(LgLgâˆ’Î¼),Ïµâ€‹Lgâ€‹K2â€‹Lf2],subscriptğ‘‡2superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘“Î”ğœ‡2subscriptğ¿ğ‘”superscriptğœ‡2ğ¾italic-Ïµsubscriptğ¿ğ‘”subscriptğ¿ğ‘”ğœ‡italic-Ïµsubscriptğ¿ğ‘”ğ¾2superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘“2\displaystyle T_{2}\in\left[\ln\left(\frac{(L_{f}+\Delta\mu)^{2}L_{g}}{\mu^{2}K\epsilon}\right)/\ln\left(\frac{L_{g}}{L_{g}-\mu}\right),\frac{\epsilon L_{g}K}{2L_{f}^{2}}\right], (100)

we have |ğ’«kâ€‹[T2]âˆ’ğ’«kVCG|â‰¤Ïµ,âˆ€kâˆˆğ’¦formulae-sequencesubscriptğ’«ğ‘˜delimited-[]subscriptğ‘‡2superscriptsubscriptğ’«ğ‘˜VCGitalic-Ïµfor-allğ‘˜ğ’¦|\mathcal{P}_{k}[T_{2}]-\mathcal{P}_{k}^{\rm VCG}|\leq\epsilon,~{}\forall k\in\mathcal{K}, and

Kâ€‹T2â‰¤(1+(Lf+Î”â€‹Î¼)2â€‹Lg2â€‹Î¼2â€‹eâ€‹Ïµ)/lnâ¡(LgLgâˆ’Î¼)=ğ’ªâ€‹(1).ğ¾subscriptğ‘‡21superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘“Î”ğœ‡2subscriptğ¿ğ‘”2superscriptğœ‡2ğ‘’italic-Ïµsubscriptğ¿ğ‘”subscriptğ¿ğ‘”ğœ‡ğ’ª1\displaystyle KT_{2}\leq\left(1+\frac{(L_{f}+\Delta\mu)^{2}L_{g}}{2\mu^{2}e\epsilon}\right)/\ln\left(\frac{L_{g}}{L_{g}-\mu}\right)=\mathcal{O}(1). (101)

We completed the proof.

IX-H Proof of Proposition 6

Let Aksubscriptğ´ğ‘˜A_{k} be an arbitrary action chosen by every agent kâˆˆğ’¦ğ‘˜ğ’¦k\in\mathcal{K}. Given an arbitrary action Aksubscriptğ´ğ‘˜A_{k} played by agent kğ‘˜k, let ğ’˜â€²superscriptğ’˜â€²\boldsymbol{w}^{\prime} be the solution in Phase I and {ğ’˜âˆ’kâ€²}kâˆˆğ’¦subscriptsubscriptsuperscriptğ’˜â€²ğ‘˜ğ‘˜ğ’¦\{\boldsymbol{w}^{\prime}_{-k}\}_{k\in\mathcal{K}} be the solution in Phase II of Algorithm 1, respectively, and ğ’«kâ€²superscriptsubscriptğ’«ğ‘˜â€²\mathcal{P}_{k}^{\prime} be the agent kğ‘˜kâ€™s payment for all kâˆˆğ’¦ğ‘˜ğ’¦k\in\mathcal{K}.

Recall that one of the termination criteria for Phase II in Algorithm 1 is:

12â€‹Î¼â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‘jâ‰ kpjâ€‹âˆ‡Fjâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ’kâ€‹[t])âˆ¥22â‰¤pkâ€‹Ïµ.12ğœ‡superscriptsubscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptğ‘—ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘ğ‘—âˆ‡subscriptğ¹ğ‘—subscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡22subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜italic-Ïµ\displaystyle\frac{1}{2\mu}\left\lVert\sum_{j\neq k}p_{j}\nabla F_{j}(\boldsymbol{w}_{-k}[t])\right\rVert_{2}^{2}\leq p_{k}\epsilon. (102)

Such a termination criteria ensures that, no matter what action Aksubscriptğ´ğ‘˜A_{k} agent kğ‘˜k plays, as long as all other agents are faithful (i.e., following the intended algorithm), we must have

âˆ‘jâ‰ kpjpkâ€‹(Fjâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ’kâ€²)âˆ’Fjâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ’kâˆ—))â‰¤Ïµ,subscriptğ‘—ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘ğ‘—subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜subscriptğ¹ğ‘—superscriptsubscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜â€²subscriptğ¹ğ‘—superscriptsubscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜italic-Ïµ\displaystyle\sum_{j\neq k}\frac{p_{j}}{p_{k}}\left(F_{j}(\boldsymbol{w}_{-k}^{\prime})-F_{j}(\boldsymbol{w}_{-k}^{*})\right)\leq\epsilon, (103)

from the Î¼ğœ‡\mu-strong convexity of Fjsubscriptğ¹ğ‘—F_{j} for all jâˆˆğ’¦ğ‘—ğ’¦j\in\mathcal{K}.

On the other hand, define ğ’«kVCG,IIâ‰œâˆ‘jâ‰ k(Fjâ€‹(ğ’˜â€²)âˆ’Fjâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ’kâ€²â€‹[T2]))â‰œsuperscriptsubscriptğ’«ğ‘˜VCGIIsubscriptğ‘—ğ‘˜subscriptğ¹ğ‘—superscriptğ’˜â€²subscriptğ¹ğ‘—subscriptsuperscriptğ’˜â€²ğ‘˜delimited-[]subscriptğ‘‡2\mathcal{P}_{k}^{\rm VCG,II}\triangleq\sum_{j\neq k}\left(F_{j}(\boldsymbol{w}^{\prime})-F_{j}(\boldsymbol{w}^{\prime}_{-k}[T_{2}])\right) as the VCG payment the algorithm approximates when agent kğ‘˜k plays Aksubscriptğ´ğ‘˜A_{k}. We have

Claim 1.

The following inequality is true:

ğ’«kVCG,IIsuperscriptsubscriptğ’«ğ‘˜VCGII\displaystyle\mathcal{P}_{k}^{\rm VCG,II} =âˆ‘jâ‰ k(Fjâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ’kâ€²â€‹[0])âˆ’Fjâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ’kâ€²â€‹[T2]))absentsubscriptğ‘—ğ‘˜subscriptğ¹ğ‘—subscriptsuperscriptğ’˜â€²ğ‘˜delimited-[]0subscriptğ¹ğ‘—subscriptsuperscriptğ’˜â€²ğ‘˜delimited-[]subscriptğ‘‡2\displaystyle=\sum_{j\neq k}\left(F_{j}(\boldsymbol{w}^{\prime}_{-k}[0])-F_{j}(\boldsymbol{w}^{\prime}_{-k}[T_{2}])\right)
=âˆ‘t=1T2âˆ‘jâ‰ k(Fjâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ’kâ€²â€‹[tâˆ’1])âˆ’Fjâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ’kâ€²â€‹[t]))absentsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¡1subscriptğ‘‡2subscriptğ‘—ğ‘˜subscriptğ¹ğ‘—subscriptsuperscriptğ’˜â€²ğ‘˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡1subscriptğ¹ğ‘—subscriptsuperscriptğ’˜â€²ğ‘˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡\displaystyle=\sum_{t=1}^{T_{2}}\sum_{j\neq k}\left(F_{j}(\boldsymbol{w}^{\prime}_{-k}[t-1])-F_{j}(\boldsymbol{w}^{\prime}_{-k}[t])\right)
â‰¤(a)â€‹âˆ‘t=1T2âˆ‘jâ‰ kâˆ‡Fjâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ’kâ€²â€‹[tâˆ’1])Tâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ’kâ€²â€‹[tâˆ’1]âˆ’ğ’˜âˆ’kâ€²â€‹[t])ğ‘superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡1subscriptğ‘‡2subscriptğ‘—ğ‘˜âˆ‡subscriptğ¹ğ‘—superscriptsubscriptsuperscriptğ’˜â€²ğ‘˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡1ğ‘‡subscriptsuperscriptğ’˜â€²ğ‘˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡1subscriptsuperscriptğ’˜â€²ğ‘˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡\displaystyle\overset{(a)}{\leq}\sum_{t=1}^{T_{2}}\sum_{j\neq k}\nabla F_{j}(\boldsymbol{w}^{\prime}_{-k}[t-1])^{T}(\boldsymbol{w}^{\prime}_{-k}[t-1]-\boldsymbol{w}^{\prime}_{-k}[t])
=ğ’«kâ€²,absentsuperscriptsubscriptğ’«ğ‘˜â€²\displaystyle=\mathcal{P}_{k}^{\prime}, (104)

where (a)ğ‘(a) is due to the convexity of Fjâ€‹(ğ°)subscriptğ¹ğ‘—ğ°F_{j}(\boldsymbol{w}) for all ğ°ğ°\boldsymbol{w} and jâˆˆğ’¦ğ‘—ğ’¦j\in\mathcal{K}.

We are ready to focus on agentâ€™s overall cost when it plays its faithful action skmsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘ ğ‘˜ğ‘šs_{k}^{m}. From |ğ’«kâ€‹[T2]âˆ’ğ’«kVCG|â‰¤Ïµsubscriptğ’«ğ‘˜delimited-[]subscriptğ‘‡2superscriptsubscriptğ’«ğ‘˜VCGitalic-Ïµ|\mathcal{P}_{k}[T_{2}]-\mathcal{P}_{k}^{\rm VCG}|\leq\epsilon as indicated in Theorem 1, we have

ğ”¼â€‹[Jkâ€‹(skm,ğ’”âˆ’km)]ğ”¼delimited-[]subscriptğ½ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ‘ ğ‘˜ğ‘šsuperscriptsubscriptğ’”ğ‘˜ğ‘š\displaystyle\mathbb{E}[J_{k}({s}_{k}^{m},\boldsymbol{s}_{-k}^{m})] â‰¤ğ”¼â€‹[âˆ‘jâˆˆğ’¦Fjâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ—)âˆ’âˆ‘jâ‰ kFjâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ’kâˆ—)+Ïµ].absentğ”¼delimited-[]subscriptğ‘—ğ’¦subscriptğ¹ğ‘—superscriptğ’˜subscriptğ‘—ğ‘˜subscriptğ¹ğ‘—superscriptsubscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜italic-Ïµ\displaystyle\leq\mathbb{E}\left[\sum_{j\in\mathcal{K}}F_{j}(\boldsymbol{w}^{*})-\sum_{j\neq k}F_{j}(\boldsymbol{w}_{-k}^{*})+\epsilon\right]. (105)

From Proposition 4, it follows that, with a probability of 1âˆ’Î´~1~ğ›¿1-\tilde{\delta}, the following inequality holds: for all possible Aksubscriptğ´ğ‘˜A_{k},

ğ”¼â€‹[Jkâ€‹(skm,ğ’”âˆ’km)]ğ”¼delimited-[]subscriptğ½ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ‘ ğ‘˜ğ‘šsuperscriptsubscriptğ’”ğ‘˜ğ‘š\displaystyle~{}~{}~{}\mathbb{E}[J_{k}({s}_{k}^{m},\boldsymbol{s}_{-k}^{m})]
â‰¤Kâ€‹minğ’˜â¡Eâ€‹(ğ’˜)âˆ’ğ”¼â€‹[âˆ‘jâ‰ kFjâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ’kâˆ—)]+Ïµ+Kâ€‹Î¦â€‹(Î´)absentğ¾subscriptğ’˜ğ¸ğ’˜ğ”¼delimited-[]subscriptğ‘—ğ‘˜subscriptğ¹ğ‘—superscriptsubscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜italic-Ïµğ¾Î¦ğ›¿\displaystyle\leq K\min_{\boldsymbol{w}}E(\boldsymbol{w})-\mathbb{E}\left[\sum_{j\neq k}F_{j}(\boldsymbol{w}_{-k}^{*})\right]+\epsilon+K\Phi(\delta)
â‰¤(b)â€‹Kâ€‹Eâ€‹(ğ’˜â€²)âˆ’ğ”¼â€‹[âˆ‘jâ‰ kFjâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ’kâ€²)]+2â€‹Ïµ+Kâ€‹Î¦â€‹(Î´)ğ‘ğ¾ğ¸superscriptğ’˜â€²ğ”¼delimited-[]subscriptğ‘—ğ‘˜subscriptğ¹ğ‘—superscriptsubscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜â€²2italic-Ïµğ¾Î¦ğ›¿\displaystyle\overset{(b)}{\leq}KE(\boldsymbol{w}^{\prime})-\mathbb{E}\left[\sum_{j\neq k}F_{j}(\boldsymbol{w}_{-k}^{\prime})\right]+2\epsilon+K\Phi(\delta)
â‰¤(c)â€‹Ekâ€‹(ğ’˜â€²)+ğ”¼â€‹[ğ’«kâ€²]+2â€‹Ïµ+Kâ€‹Î¦â€‹(Î´)ğ‘subscriptğ¸ğ‘˜superscriptğ’˜â€²ğ”¼delimited-[]superscriptsubscriptğ’«ğ‘˜â€²2italic-Ïµğ¾Î¦ğ›¿\displaystyle\overset{(c)}{\leq}E_{k}(\boldsymbol{w}^{\prime})+\mathbb{E}[\mathcal{P}_{k}^{\prime}]+2\epsilon+K\Phi(\delta)
=ğ”¼â€‹[Jkâ€‹(Ak,ğ’”âˆ’km)]+2â€‹Ïµ+Kâ€‹Î¦â€‹(Î´),absentğ”¼delimited-[]subscriptğ½ğ‘˜subscriptğ´ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ’”ğ‘˜ğ‘š2italic-Ïµğ¾Î¦ğ›¿\displaystyle=\mathbb{E}[J_{k}(A_{k},\boldsymbol{s}_{-k}^{m})]+2\epsilon+K\Phi(\delta), (106)

where (b) is from (103), and (c) is from (104).

IX-I Proof of Proposition 7

From Assumption 3, we have that RB{ğ’¦}â‰¤RBğ’subscriptRBğ’¦subscriptRBğ’{\rm RB}_{\{\mathcal{K}\}}\leq{\rm RB}_{\mathcal{C}}. If we select ğ’={{k},ğ’¦\{k}}ğ’ğ‘˜\ğ’¦ğ‘˜\mathcal{C}=\{\{k\},\mathcal{K}\backslash\{k\}\}, the inequality RB{ğ’¦}â‰¤RBğ’subscriptRBğ’¦subscriptRBğ’{\rm RB}_{\{\mathcal{K}\}}\leq{\rm RB}_{\mathcal{C}} becomes:

pkâ€‹Lâ„“2â€‹dâ€‹logâ¡(2â€‹d/Î´)4â€‹Î¼â€‹nk+âˆ‘jâ‰ kpj2(1âˆ’pk)2â€‹nkâ€‹Lâ„“2â€‹dâ€‹logâ¡(2â€‹Kâ€‹d/Î´)4â€‹Î¼subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ¿â„“2ğ‘‘2ğ‘‘ğ›¿4ğœ‡subscriptğ‘›ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘—ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘—2superscript1subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜2subscriptğ‘›ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ¿â„“2ğ‘‘2ğ¾ğ‘‘ğ›¿4ğœ‡\displaystyle p_{k}\frac{L_{\ell}^{2}d\log(2d/\delta)}{4\mu n_{k}}+\sum_{j\neq k}\frac{p_{j}^{2}}{(1-p_{k})^{2}n_{k}}\frac{L_{\ell}^{2}d\log(2Kd/\delta)}{4\mu}
+âˆ‘jâ‰ k2â€‹pjâ€‹âˆ¥Pjâ€‹(â‹…)âˆ’PÂ¯ğ’¦\{k}â€‹(â‹…)âˆ¥subscriptğ‘—ğ‘˜2subscriptğ‘ğ‘—delimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptğ‘ƒğ‘—â‹…subscriptÂ¯ğ‘ƒ\ğ’¦ğ‘˜â‹…\displaystyle+\sum_{j\neq k}2p_{j}\left\lVert P_{j}(\cdot)-\bar{P}_{\mathcal{K}\backslash\{k\}}(\cdot)\right\rVert
â‰¥\displaystyle\geq âˆ‘jâˆˆğ’¦pj2njâ€‹Lâ„“2â€‹dâ€‹logâ¡(2â€‹dâ€‹K/Î´)4â€‹Î¼+2â€‹âˆ‘kâˆˆğ’¦pkâ€‹âˆ¥Pkâ€‹(â‹…)âˆ’âˆ‘jâˆˆğ’¦pjâ€‹Pjâ€‹(â‹…)âˆ¥.subscriptğ‘—ğ’¦superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘—2subscriptğ‘›ğ‘—superscriptsubscriptğ¿â„“2ğ‘‘2ğ‘‘ğ¾ğ›¿4ğœ‡2subscriptğ‘˜ğ’¦subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜delimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptğ‘ƒğ‘˜â‹…subscriptğ‘—ğ’¦subscriptğ‘ğ‘—subscriptğ‘ƒğ‘—â‹…\displaystyle\sum_{j\in\mathcal{K}}\frac{p_{j}^{2}}{n_{j}}\frac{L_{\ell}^{2}d\log(2dK/\delta)}{4\mu}+2\sum_{k\in\mathcal{K}}p_{k}\left\lVert P_{k}(\cdot)-\sum_{j\in\mathcal{K}}p_{j}P_{j}(\cdot)\right\rVert. (107)

In addition, from |ğ’«kâ€‹[T2]âˆ’ğ’«kVCG|â‰¤Ïµsubscriptğ’«ğ‘˜delimited-[]subscriptğ‘‡2superscriptsubscriptğ’«ğ‘˜VCGitalic-Ïµ|\mathcal{P}_{k}[T_{2}]-\mathcal{P}_{k}^{\rm VCG}|\leq\epsilon as indicated in Theorem 1, it follows that

ğ”¼â€‹[Jkâ€‹(skm,ğ’”âˆ’km)]â‰¤minğ’˜â€‹âˆ‘jâˆˆğ’¦pjpkâ€‹Ejâ€‹(ğ’˜)âˆ’minğ’˜â€‹âˆ‘jâ‰ kpjpkâ€‹Ejâ€‹(ğ’˜)+Ïµ,ğ”¼delimited-[]subscriptğ½ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ‘ ğ‘˜ğ‘šsuperscriptsubscriptğ’”ğ‘˜ğ‘šsubscriptğ’˜subscriptğ‘—ğ’¦subscriptğ‘ğ‘—subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜subscriptğ¸ğ‘—ğ’˜subscriptğ’˜subscriptğ‘—ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘ğ‘—subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜subscriptğ¸ğ‘—ğ’˜italic-Ïµ\displaystyle\mathbb{E}[J_{k}({s}_{k}^{m},\boldsymbol{s}_{-k}^{m})]\leq\min_{\boldsymbol{w}}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{K}}\frac{p_{j}}{p_{k}}E_{j}(\boldsymbol{w})-\min_{\boldsymbol{w}}\sum_{j\neq k}\frac{p_{j}}{p_{k}}E_{j}(\boldsymbol{w})+\epsilon, (108)

Therefore, combining (107) and (108), we prove Proposition 7.

IX-J Proof of Proposition 8

From (24a) and (24b), we have

ğ’«kâˆ—=âˆ‘t=1T2Î·2pkâ€‹âˆ¥âˆ‘jâ‰ kpjâ€‹âˆ‡Fjâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ’kâ€‹[t])âˆ¥22â‰¥0,âˆ€kâˆˆğ’¦.formulae-sequencesuperscriptsubscriptğ’«ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡1subscriptğ‘‡2subscriptğœ‚2subscriptğ‘ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptğ‘—ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘ğ‘—âˆ‡subscriptğ¹ğ‘—subscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡220for-allğ‘˜ğ’¦\displaystyle\mathcal{P}_{k}^{*}=\sum_{t=1}^{T_{2}}\frac{\eta_{2}}{p_{k}}\left\lVert\sum_{j\neq k}p_{j}\nabla F_{j}(\boldsymbol{w}_{-k}[t])\right\rVert_{2}^{2}\geq 0,~{}\forall k\in\mathcal{K}. (109)

Hence, we have completed the proof of Proposition 8.

IX-K Proof of Theorem 2

Based on the proof of Lemma 2, the distance between ğ’˜âˆ’kâˆ—subscriptsuperscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜\boldsymbol{w}^{*}_{-k} and ğ’˜mâˆ—subscriptsuperscriptğ’˜ğ‘š\boldsymbol{w}^{*}_{m} is given by

âˆ¥ğ’˜loâˆ’ğ’˜âˆ’koâˆ¥2subscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscriptğ’˜ğ‘™ğ‘œsubscriptsuperscriptğ’˜ğ‘œğ‘˜2\displaystyle~{}~{}\left\lVert\boldsymbol{w}_{l}^{o}-\boldsymbol{w}^{o}_{-k}\right\rVert_{2}
=âˆ¥âˆ«01âˆ‚ğ’˜oâ€‹(ğ€)âˆ‚Î»kâ€‹ğ‘‘Î»kâˆ¥2absentsubscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscript01superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œğ€subscriptğœ†ğ‘˜differential-dsubscriptğœ†ğ‘˜2\displaystyle=\left\lVert\int_{0}^{1}\frac{\partial\boldsymbol{w}^{o}(\boldsymbol{\lambda})}{\partial\lambda_{k}}d{\lambda_{k}}\right\rVert_{2}
â‰¤âˆ«01âˆ¥âˆ‚ğ’˜âˆ—â€‹(ğ€)âˆ‚Î»kâˆ¥2â€‹ğ‘‘Î»kabsentsuperscriptsubscript01subscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptğ’˜ğ€subscriptğœ†ğ‘˜2differential-dsubscriptğœ†ğ‘˜\displaystyle\leq\int_{0}^{1}\left\lVert\frac{\partial\boldsymbol{w}^{*}(\boldsymbol{\lambda})}{\partial\lambda_{k}}\right\rVert_{2}d{\lambda_{k}}
â‰¤âˆ«01âˆ¥(âˆ‘kâˆˆğ’¦âˆ‡ğ’˜2Fkâ€‹(ğ’˜,ğ€))âˆ’1â€‹âˆ‡Fkâ€‹(ğ’˜)âˆ¥2â€‹ğ‘‘Î»kabsentsuperscriptsubscript01subscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ’¦superscriptsubscriptâˆ‡ğ’˜2subscriptğ¹ğ‘˜ğ’˜ğ€1âˆ‡subscriptğ¹ğ‘˜ğ’˜2differential-dsubscriptğœ†ğ‘˜\displaystyle\leq\int_{0}^{1}\left\lVert\left(\sum_{k\in\mathcal{K}}\nabla_{\boldsymbol{w}}^{2}F_{k}(\boldsymbol{w},\boldsymbol{\lambda})\right)^{-1}\nabla F_{k}(\boldsymbol{w})\right\rVert_{2}d{\lambda_{k}}
â‰¤âˆ«01âˆ¥(âˆ‘kâˆˆğ’¦âˆ‡ğ’˜2Fkâ€‹(ğ’˜,ğ€))âˆ’1âˆ¥2â€‹âˆ‘jâˆˆğ’l\{k}âˆ¥âˆ‡Fjâ€‹(ğ’˜)âˆ¥2â€‹dâ€‹Î»jabsentsuperscriptsubscript01subscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜ğ’¦superscriptsubscriptâˆ‡ğ’˜2subscriptğ¹ğ‘˜ğ’˜ğ€12subscriptğ‘—\subscriptğ’ğ‘™ğ‘˜subscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥âˆ‡subscriptğ¹ğ‘—ğ’˜2ğ‘‘subscriptğœ†ğ‘—\displaystyle\leq\int_{0}^{1}\left\lVert\left(\sum_{k\in\mathcal{K}}\nabla_{\boldsymbol{w}}^{2}F_{k}(\boldsymbol{w},\boldsymbol{\lambda})\right)^{-1}\right\rVert_{2}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{C}_{l}\backslash\{k\}}\left\lVert\nabla F_{j}(\boldsymbol{w})\right\rVert_{2}d{\lambda_{j}}
â‰¤âˆ«01Lfâ€‹(âŒˆK/MâŒ‰âˆ’1)Î¼â€‹Kâ€‹ğ‘‘Î»kâ‰¤LfÎ¼â€‹M.absentsuperscriptsubscript01subscriptğ¿ğ‘“ğ¾ğ‘€1ğœ‡ğ¾differential-dsubscriptğœ†ğ‘˜subscriptğ¿ğ‘“ğœ‡ğ‘€\displaystyle\leq\int_{0}^{1}\frac{L_{f}(\lceil K/M\rceil-1)}{\mu K}d{\lambda_{k}}\leq\frac{L_{f}}{\mu M}. (110)

Hence, we have

|ğ’«kSâˆ’ğ’«kVCG|superscriptsubscriptğ’«ğ‘˜Ssuperscriptsubscriptğ’«ğ‘˜VCG\displaystyle|\mathcal{P}_{k}^{\rm S}-\mathcal{P}_{k}^{\rm VCG}| =|âˆ‘jâ‰ k(Fjâ€‹(ğ’˜mâˆ—)âˆ’Fjâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ’kâˆ—))|absentsubscriptğ‘—ğ‘˜subscriptğ¹ğ‘—superscriptsubscriptğ’˜ğ‘šsubscriptğ¹ğ‘—subscriptsuperscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜\displaystyle=\left|\sum_{j\neq k}\left(F_{j}(\boldsymbol{w}_{m}^{*})-F_{j}(\boldsymbol{w}^{*}_{-k})\right)\right|
â‰¤(a)â€‹(Kâˆ’1)â€‹Lg2â€‹âˆ¥ğ’˜mâˆ—âˆ’ğ’˜âˆ’kâˆ—âˆ¥22ğ‘ğ¾1subscriptğ¿ğ‘”2superscriptsubscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscriptğ’˜ğ‘šsubscriptsuperscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜22\displaystyle\overset{(a)}{\leq}\frac{(K-1)L_{g}}{2}\left\lVert\boldsymbol{w}_{m}^{*}-\boldsymbol{w}^{*}_{-k}\right\rVert_{2}^{2}
â‰¤(Kâˆ’1)â€‹Lf2â€‹Lg2â€‹Î¼2â€‹M2,âˆ€kâˆˆğ’¦,formulae-sequenceabsentğ¾1superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘“2subscriptğ¿ğ‘”2superscriptğœ‡2superscriptğ‘€2for-allğ‘˜ğ’¦\displaystyle\leq\frac{(K-1)L_{f}^{2}L_{g}}{2\mu^{2}M^{2}},~{}\forall k\in\mathcal{K}, (111)

where (a) is by the Lgsubscriptğ¿ğ‘”L_{g}-smoothness of Fjâ€‹(ğ’˜)subscriptğ¹ğ‘—ğ’˜F_{j}(\boldsymbol{w}). Hence, if we select

Mâ‰¥minâ¡{K,Lgâ€‹(Kâˆ’1)2â€‹Ïµâ€‹LfÎ¼}=ğ’ªâ€‹(KÏµ).ğ‘€ğ¾subscriptğ¿ğ‘”ğ¾12italic-Ïµsubscriptğ¿ğ‘“ğœ‡ğ’ªğ¾italic-Ïµ\displaystyle M\geq\min\left\{K,\sqrt{\frac{L_{g}(K-1)}{2\epsilon}}\frac{L_{f}}{\mu}\right\}=\mathcal{O}\left(\sqrt{\frac{K}{\epsilon}}\right). (112)

then we have |ğ’«kSâˆ’ğ’«kVCG|â‰¤Ïµsuperscriptsubscriptğ’«ğ‘˜Ssuperscriptsubscriptğ’«ğ‘˜VCGitalic-Ïµ\left|\mathcal{P}_{k}^{\rm S}-\mathcal{P}_{k}^{\rm VCG}\right|\leq\epsilon.

IX-L Proof of Proposition 9

The main proof of Proposition 9 is based on [8]. We start with the following intermediate notation of concentrated differential privacy [53]:

Definition 9.

A randomized mechanism â„³:ğ’Ÿnâ†’â„d:â„³â†’superscriptğ’Ÿğ‘›superscriptâ„ğ‘‘\mathcal{M}:\mathcal{D}^{n}\rightarrow\mathbb{R}^{d} is ÏğœŒ\rho-Zero-Concentrated Differential Privacy (ÏğœŒ\rho-zCDP) if for any two adjacent datasets ğ’³ğ’³\mathcal{X} and ğ’³â€²âˆˆğ’Ÿnsuperscriptğ’³â€²superscriptğ’Ÿğ‘›\mathcal{X}^{\prime}\in\mathcal{D}^{n} differing in one sample, it holds for all aâˆˆ(1,âˆ)ğ‘1a\in(1,\infty) that

ğ”¼â€‹[expâ¡((aâˆ’1)â€‹logâ¡â„™â€‹[â„³â€‹(ğ’³)=y]â„™â€‹[â„³â€‹(ğ’³â€²)=y])]â‰¤expâ¡((aâˆ’1)â€‹aâ€‹Ï),ğ”¼delimited-[]ğ‘1â„™delimited-[]â„³ğ’³ğ‘¦â„™delimited-[]â„³superscriptğ’³â€²ğ‘¦ğ‘1ğ‘ğœŒ\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[\exp\left((a-1)\log\frac{\mathbb{P}[\mathcal{M}(\mathcal{\mathcal{X}})=y]}{\mathbb{P}[\mathcal{M}(\mathcal{\mathcal{X}^{\prime}})=y]}\right)\right]\leq\exp((a-1)a\rho), (113)

for yâˆˆâ„dğ‘¦superscriptâ„ğ‘‘y\in\mathbb{R}^{d}.

Bun and Steinke in [53] provided the following lemmas to achieve zCDP with the Gaussian mechanism. Lemmas 4-6 bound the amount of Gaussian noise to guarantee zCDP, give the composition of multiple zCDP mechanisms, and specify the mapping from different privacy metrics.

Lemma 4.

Given a function q:ğ’Ÿâ†’â„n:ğ‘â†’ğ’Ÿsuperscriptâ„ğ‘›q:\mathcal{D}\rightarrow\mathbb{R}^{n}, the outcome â„³=qâ€‹(ğ’Ÿ)+ğ®â„³ğ‘ğ’Ÿğ®\mathcal{M}=q(\mathcal{D})+\boldsymbol{u}, where ğ®âˆˆğ’©â€‹(ğŸ,Ïƒ2â€‹ğˆd)ğ®ğ’©0superscriptğœ2subscriptğˆğ‘‘\boldsymbol{u}\in\mathcal{N}(\boldsymbol{0},\sigma^{2}\boldsymbol{I}_{d}), satisfies Î”2â€‹(q)2/(2â€‹Ïƒ2)subscriptÎ”2superscriptğ‘22superscriptğœ2\Delta_{2}(q)^{2}/(2\sigma^{2})-zCDP.

Lemma 5.

For any two mechanisms â„³1:ğ’Ÿâ†’â„d:subscriptâ„³1â†’ğ’Ÿsuperscriptâ„ğ‘‘\mathcal{M}_{1}:\mathcal{D}\rightarrow\mathbb{R}^{d} and â„³2:ğ’ŸÃ—â„dâ†’â„d:subscriptâ„³2â†’ğ’Ÿsuperscriptâ„ğ‘‘superscriptâ„ğ‘‘\mathcal{M}_{2}:\mathcal{D}\times\mathbb{R}^{d}\rightarrow\mathbb{R}^{d}. â„³2â€‹(D,â„³1â€‹(D))subscriptâ„³2ğ·subscriptâ„³1ğ·\mathcal{M}_{2}(D,\mathcal{M}_{1}(D)) satisfies (Ï1+Ï2)subscriptğœŒ1subscriptğœŒ2(\rho_{1}+\rho_{2})-zCDP.

Lemma 6.

If a randomized mechanism â„³â„³\mathcal{M}: ğ’Ÿnâ†’â„dâ†’superscriptğ’Ÿğ‘›superscriptâ„ğ‘‘\mathcal{D}^{n}\rightarrow\mathbb{R}^{d} satisfies ÏğœŒ\rho-zCDP, then it satisfies (Ï+2â€‹Ïâ€‹logâ¡(1/Î´),Î´)ğœŒ2ğœŒ1ğ›¿ğ›¿(\rho+2\sqrt{\rho\log(1/\delta)},\delta)-DP for any Î´ğ›¿\delta.

Define Fkâ€‹(ğ’˜,ğ’Ÿk)subscriptğ¹ğ‘˜ğ’˜subscriptğ’Ÿğ‘˜F_{k}(\boldsymbol{w},\mathcal{D}_{k}) as the empirical risk given the local dataset ğ’Ÿksubscriptğ’Ÿğ‘˜\mathcal{D}_{k}:

Fkâ€‹(ğ’˜,ğ’Ÿk)=1Kâ€‹âˆ‘k=11nkâ€‹âˆ‘i=1nkâ„“â€‹(ğ’˜,ğ’™i,yi),subscriptğ¹ğ‘˜ğ’˜subscriptğ’Ÿğ‘˜1ğ¾subscriptğ‘˜11subscriptğ‘›ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1subscriptğ‘›ğ‘˜â„“ğ’˜subscriptğ’™ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¦ğ‘–\displaystyle F_{k}(\boldsymbol{w},\mathcal{D}_{k})=\frac{1}{K}\sum_{k=1}\frac{1}{n_{k}}\sum_{i=1}^{n_{k}}\ell(\boldsymbol{w},\boldsymbol{x}_{i},y_{i}), (114)

Given a gradient computation in iteration tğ‘¡t in Algorithm 2, we define

Mk,tâ‰œâ‰œsubscriptğ‘€ğ‘˜ğ‘¡absent\displaystyle M_{k,t}\triangleq âˆ‡Fkâ€‹(ğ’˜,ğ’Ÿk)+ğ’©â€‹(ğŸ,Ïƒ2â€‹ğ‘°d)âˆ‡subscriptğ¹ğ‘˜ğ’˜subscriptğ’Ÿğ‘˜ğ’©0superscriptğœ2subscriptğ‘°ğ‘‘\displaystyle\nabla F_{k}(\boldsymbol{w},\mathcal{D}_{k})+\mathcal{N}(\boldsymbol{0},\sigma^{2}\boldsymbol{I}_{d})
=\displaystyle= 1Kâ€‹âˆ‘k=11nkâ€‹âˆ‘i=1nkâˆ‡â„“â€‹(ğ’˜Tâ€‹ğ’™i,yi)+ğ’©â€‹(ğŸ,Ïƒ2â€‹ğ‘°d).1ğ¾subscriptğ‘˜11subscriptğ‘›ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1subscriptğ‘›ğ‘˜âˆ‡â„“superscriptğ’˜ğ‘‡subscriptğ’™ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¦ğ‘–ğ’©0superscriptğœ2subscriptğ‘°ğ‘‘\displaystyle\frac{1}{K}\sum_{k=1}\frac{1}{n_{k}}\sum_{i=1}^{n_{k}}\nabla\ell(\boldsymbol{w}^{T}\boldsymbol{x}_{i},y_{i})+\mathcal{N}(\boldsymbol{0},\sigma^{2}\boldsymbol{I}_{d}). (115)

Supposing ğ’Ÿksubscriptğ’Ÿğ‘˜\mathcal{D}_{k} and ğ’Ÿkâ€²superscriptsubscriptğ’Ÿğ‘˜â€²\mathcal{D}_{k}^{\prime} only differ in one sample, we have

âˆ¥âˆ‡Fâ€‹(ğ’˜,ğ’Ÿk)âˆ’âˆ‡Fâ€‹(ğ’˜,ğ’Ÿkâ€²)âˆ¥2â‰¤2â€‹LfKâ€‹n(1).subscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥âˆ‡ğ¹ğ’˜subscriptğ’Ÿğ‘˜âˆ‡ğ¹ğ’˜superscriptsubscriptğ’Ÿğ‘˜â€²22subscriptğ¿ğ‘“ğ¾subscriptğ‘›1\displaystyle\left\lVert\nabla F(\boldsymbol{w},\mathcal{D}_{k})-\nabla F(\boldsymbol{w},\mathcal{D}_{k}^{\prime})\right\rVert_{2}\leq\frac{2L_{f}}{Kn_{(1)}}. (116)

Thus, using Lemma 4, we have that Mk,tsubscriptğ‘€ğ‘˜ğ‘¡M_{k,t} is ÏğœŒ\rho-zCDP where Ï=2â€‹Lf2K2â€‹n(1)2â€‹Ïƒ2ğœŒ2superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘“2superscriptğ¾2superscriptsubscriptğ‘›12superscriptğœ2\rho=\frac{2L_{f}^{2}}{K^{2}n_{(1)}^{2}\sigma^{2}}. On the other hand, by adopting the noise ÏƒP2subscriptsuperscriptğœ2ğ‘ƒ\sigma^{2}_{P} in (53), we have that

Mkâ€²subscriptsuperscriptğ‘€â€²ğ‘˜\displaystyle M^{\prime}_{k} =ğ’«kSâ€‹(ğ’Ÿ)+ğ’©â€‹(0,ÏƒP2),âˆ€kâˆˆğ’¦,formulae-sequenceabsentsuperscriptsubscriptğ’«ğ‘˜ğ‘†ğ’Ÿğ’©0superscriptsubscriptğœğ‘ƒ2for-allğ‘˜ğ’¦\displaystyle=\mathcal{P}_{k}^{S}(\mathcal{D})+\mathcal{N}({0},\sigma_{P}^{2}),\forall k\in\mathcal{K}, (117)

where ğ’«kSâ€‹(ğ’Ÿ)â‰œâˆ‘jâ‰ k(Fjâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ—,ğ’Ÿj)âˆ’Fjâ€‹(ğ’˜lâˆ—,ğ’Ÿj)).â‰œsuperscriptsubscriptğ’«ğ‘˜ğ‘†ğ’Ÿsubscriptğ‘—ğ‘˜subscriptğ¹ğ‘—superscriptğ’˜subscriptğ’Ÿğ‘—subscriptğ¹ğ‘—superscriptsubscriptğ’˜ğ‘™subscriptğ’Ÿğ‘—\mathcal{P}_{k}^{S}(\mathcal{D})\triangleq\sum_{j\neq k}\left({F}_{j}(\boldsymbol{w}^{*},\mathcal{D}_{j})-{F}_{j}(\boldsymbol{w}_{l}^{*},\mathcal{D}_{j})\right). Suppose that ğ’Ÿğ’Ÿ\mathcal{D} and ğ’Ÿâ€²superscriptğ’Ÿâ€²\mathcal{D}^{\prime} only differ in one sample,

âˆ¥ğ’«kSâ€‹(ğ’Ÿ)âˆ’ğ’«kSâ€‹(ğ’Ÿâ€²)âˆ¥2â‰¤2n(1),âˆ€kâˆˆğ’¦.formulae-sequencesubscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscriptğ’«ğ‘˜ğ‘†ğ’Ÿsuperscriptsubscriptğ’«ğ‘˜ğ‘†superscriptğ’Ÿâ€²22subscriptğ‘›1for-allğ‘˜ğ’¦\displaystyle\left\lVert\mathcal{P}_{k}^{S}(\mathcal{D})-\mathcal{P}_{k}^{S}(\mathcal{D^{\prime}})\right\rVert_{2}\leq\frac{2}{n_{(1)}},\forall k\in\mathcal{K}. (118)

Using Lemma 4, we have that Mkâ€²superscriptsubscriptğ‘€ğ‘˜â€²M_{k}^{\prime} is ÏPsubscriptğœŒğ‘ƒ\rho_{P}-zCDP where ÏP=2n(1)2â€‹ÏƒP2subscriptğœŒğ‘ƒ2superscriptsubscriptğ‘›12superscriptsubscriptğœğ‘ƒ2\rho_{P}=\frac{2}{n_{(1)}^{2}\sigma_{P}^{2}}.

From Lemma 5, we have that ğ’˜âˆ—superscriptğ’˜\boldsymbol{w}^{*} is T1â€‹Ïsubscriptğ‘‡1ğœŒT_{1}\rho-zCDP, {ğ’˜l}âˆ—superscriptsubscriptğ’˜ğ‘™\{\boldsymbol{w}_{l}\}^{*} are Kâ€‹T2â€‹Ïğ¾subscriptğ‘‡2ğœŒKT_{2}\rho-zCDP. From (116) and (118), to make sure {ğ’«kâˆ—}kâˆˆğ’¦subscriptsuperscriptsubscriptğ’«ğ‘˜ğ‘˜ğ’¦\{\mathcal{P}_{k}^{*}\}_{k\in\mathcal{K}} are (T1+Kâ€‹T2)â€‹Ïsubscriptğ‘‡1ğ¾subscriptğ‘‡2ğœŒ(T_{1}+KT_{2})\rho-zCDP, i.e., (T1+Kâ€‹T2)â€‹Ï=Kâ€‹ÏPsubscriptğ‘‡1ğ¾subscriptğ‘‡2ğœŒğ¾subscriptğœŒğ‘ƒ(T_{1}+KT_{2})\rho=K\rho_{P}, it follows that

(T1+Kâ€‹T2)â€‹Ï=2â€‹Kn(1)2â€‹ÏƒP2subscriptğ‘‡1ğ¾subscriptğ‘‡2ğœŒ2ğ¾superscriptsubscriptğ‘›12superscriptsubscriptğœğ‘ƒ2\displaystyle(T_{1}+KT_{2})\rho=\frac{2K}{n_{(1)}^{2}\sigma_{P}^{2}} =2â€‹(T1+Kâ€‹T2)â€‹Lf2K2â€‹n(1)2â€‹Ïƒ2,absent2subscriptğ‘‡1ğ¾subscriptğ‘‡2superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘“2superscriptğ¾2superscriptsubscriptğ‘›12superscriptğœ2\displaystyle=\frac{2(T_{1}+KT_{2})L_{f}^{2}}{K^{2}n_{(1)}^{2}\sigma^{2}},
âŸ¶ÏƒP2âŸ¶absentsuperscriptsubscriptğœğ‘ƒ2\displaystyle\longrightarrow~{}~{}~{}\sigma_{P}^{2} =Ïƒ2â€‹K3(T1+Kâ€‹T2)â€‹Lf2,absentsuperscriptğœ2superscriptğ¾3subscriptğ‘‡1ğ¾subscriptğ‘‡2superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘“2\displaystyle=\frac{\sigma^{2}K^{3}}{(T_{1}+KT_{2})L_{f}^{2}}, (119)

which leads to an overall 2â€‹(T1+Kâ€‹T2)â€‹Ï2subscriptğ‘‡1ğ¾subscriptğ‘‡2ğœŒ2(T_{1}+KT_{2})\rho-zCDP for Algorithm 2, according to Lemma 5.

Lemma 6 shows that Algorithm 2 is also (2â€‹(T1+Kâ€‹T2)â€‹Ï+2â€‹2â€‹(T1+Kâ€‹T2)â€‹Ïâ€‹logâ¡(1/Î´),Î´)2subscriptğ‘‡1ğ¾subscriptğ‘‡2ğœŒ22subscriptğ‘‡1ğ¾subscriptğ‘‡2ğœŒ1ğ›¿ğ›¿(2(T_{1}+KT_{2})\rho+2\sqrt{2(T_{1}+KT_{2})\rho\log(1/\delta)},\delta)-DP for any Î´âˆˆ(0,1)ğ›¿01\delta\in(0,1). It follows from Lemma 6 that

ÏğœŒ\displaystyle\rho â‰ˆÎ±28â€‹(T1+T2â€‹K)â€‹logâ¡(1/Î²),absentsuperscriptğ›¼28subscriptğ‘‡1subscriptğ‘‡2ğ¾1ğ›½\displaystyle\approx\frac{\alpha^{2}}{8(T_{1}+T_{2}K)\log(1/\beta)},
âŸ¶Ïƒ2âŸ¶absentsuperscriptğœ2\displaystyle\longrightarrow~{}~{}~{}\sigma^{2} =16â€‹Lf2â€‹(T1+Kâ€‹T2)â€‹logâ¡(1/Î²)K2â€‹n(1)2â€‹Î±2,absent16superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘“2subscriptğ‘‡1ğ¾subscriptğ‘‡21ğ›½superscriptğ¾2superscriptsubscriptğ‘›12superscriptğ›¼2\displaystyle=\frac{16L_{f}^{2}(T_{1}+KT_{2})\log(1/\beta)}{K^{2}n_{(1)}^{2}\alpha^{2}}, (120)
ÏƒP2superscriptsubscriptğœğ‘ƒ2\displaystyle\sigma_{P}^{2} =16â€‹Kâ€‹logâ¡(1/Î²)n(1)2â€‹Î±2.absent16ğ¾1ğ›½superscriptsubscriptğ‘›12superscriptğ›¼2\displaystyle=\frac{16K\log(1/\beta)}{n_{(1)}^{2}\alpha^{2}}. (121)

IX-M Proof of Proposition 10

From the Lgsubscriptğ¿ğ‘”L_{g}-smoothness assumption, it follows that

ğ”¼â€‹[Fâ€‹(ğ’˜â€‹[t+1])âˆ’Fâ€‹(ğ’˜â€‹[t])]ğ”¼delimited-[]ğ¹ğ’˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡1ğ¹ğ’˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡\displaystyle~{}~{}\mathbb{E}\left[F(\boldsymbol{w}[t+1])-F(\boldsymbol{w}[t])\right]
â‰¤ğ”¼â€‹[âˆ‡Fâ€‹(ğ’˜â€‹[t])Tâ€‹(Fâ€‹(ğ’˜â€‹[t+1])âˆ’Fâ€‹(ğ’˜â€‹[t]))+12â€‹Lgâ€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡Fâ€‹(ğ’˜â€‹[t])+ğ’âˆ¥22]absentğ”¼delimited-[]âˆ‡ğ¹superscriptğ’˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡ğ‘‡ğ¹ğ’˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡1ğ¹ğ’˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡12subscriptğ¿ğ‘”superscriptsubscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥âˆ‡ğ¹ğ’˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡ğ’22\displaystyle\leq\mathbb{E}\left[\nabla F(\boldsymbol{w}[t])^{T}\left(F(\boldsymbol{w}[t+1])-F(\boldsymbol{w}[t])\right)+\frac{1}{2L_{g}}\left\lVert\nabla F(\boldsymbol{w}[t])+\boldsymbol{n}\right\rVert_{2}^{2}\right]
=âˆ’12â€‹Lgâ€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡Fâ€‹(ğ’˜â€‹[t])âˆ¥22+12â€‹Lgâ€‹ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥ğ’âˆ¥22absent12subscriptğ¿ğ‘”superscriptsubscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥âˆ‡ğ¹ğ’˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡2212subscriptğ¿ğ‘”ğ”¼superscriptsubscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥ğ’22\displaystyle=-\frac{1}{2L_{g}}\left\lVert\nabla F(\boldsymbol{w}[t])\right\rVert_{2}^{2}+\frac{1}{2L_{g}}\mathbb{E}\left\lVert\boldsymbol{n}\right\rVert_{2}^{2}
â‰¤âˆ’Î¼Lgâ€‹(Fâ€‹(ğ’˜â€‹[t])âˆ’Fâ€‹(ğ’˜o))+dâ€‹Ïƒ22â€‹Lg.absentğœ‡subscriptğ¿ğ‘”ğ¹ğ’˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡ğ¹superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œğ‘‘superscriptğœ22subscriptğ¿ğ‘”\displaystyle\leq-\frac{\mu}{L_{g}}(F(\boldsymbol{w}[t])-F(\boldsymbol{w}^{o}))+\frac{d\sigma^{2}}{2L_{g}}. (122)

The last inequality results from the Î¼ğœ‡\mu-strong convexity assumption. The above equation can be written as:

ğ”¼â€‹[Fâ€‹(ğ’˜â€‹[t+1])âˆ’Fâ€‹(ğ’˜o)]ğ”¼delimited-[]ğ¹ğ’˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡1ğ¹superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œ\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[F(\boldsymbol{w}[t+1])-F(\boldsymbol{w}^{o})\right] â‰¤(1âˆ’Î¼Lg)T1â€‹(Fâ€‹(ğ’˜â€‹[0])âˆ’Fâ€‹(ğ’˜o))absentsuperscript1ğœ‡subscriptğ¿ğ‘”subscriptğ‘‡1ğ¹ğ’˜delimited-[]0ğ¹superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œ\displaystyle\leq\left(1-\frac{\mu}{L_{g}}\right)^{T_{1}}(F(\boldsymbol{w}[0])-F(\boldsymbol{w}^{o}))
+dâ€‹Ïƒ22â€‹Î¼.ğ‘‘superscriptğœ22ğœ‡\displaystyle~{}~{}+\frac{d\sigma^{2}}{2\mu}. (123)

When T1=ğ’ªâ€‹(logâ¡(K2â€‹n(1)2â€‹Î±2dâ€‹Lf2â€‹logâ¡(1/Î²)))subscriptğ‘‡1ğ’ªsuperscriptğ¾2superscriptsubscriptğ‘›12superscriptğ›¼2ğ‘‘superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘“21ğ›½T_{1}=\mathcal{O}\left(\log\left(\frac{K^{2}n_{(1)}^{2}\alpha^{2}}{dL_{f}^{2}\log(1/\beta)}\right)\right) and T2=ğ’ªâ€‹(logâ¡(K2â€‹n(1)2â€‹Î±2dâ€‹Lf2â€‹logâ¡(1/Î²)))subscriptğ‘‡2ğ’ªsuperscriptğ¾2superscriptsubscriptğ‘›12superscriptğ›¼2ğ‘‘superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘“21ğ›½T_{2}=\mathcal{O}\left(\log\left(\frac{K^{2}n_{(1)}^{2}\alpha^{2}}{dL_{f}^{2}\log(1/\beta)}\right)\right), it follows that

ğ”¼â€‹[Fâ€‹(ğ’˜â€‹[T1])]âˆ’Fâ€‹(ğ’˜o)ğ”¼delimited-[]ğ¹ğ’˜delimited-[]subscriptğ‘‡1ğ¹superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œ\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[F(\boldsymbol{w}[T_{1}])\right]-F(\boldsymbol{w}^{o}) â‰¤C1â€‹Lf2â€‹dâ€‹logâ¡(Kâ€‹n(1))â€‹logâ¡(1/Î²)K2â€‹n(1)2â€‹Î±2,absentsubscriptğ¶1superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘“2ğ‘‘ğ¾subscriptğ‘›11ğ›½superscriptğ¾2superscriptsubscriptğ‘›12superscriptğ›¼2\displaystyle\leq C_{1}\frac{L_{f}^{2}d\log(Kn_{(1)})\log(1/\beta)}{K^{2}n_{(1)}^{2}\alpha^{2}}, (124)

for some constant C1>0subscriptğ¶10C_{1}>0.

Finally, according to [46],

Eâ€‹(ğ’˜â€‹[T1])âˆ’minğ’˜â¡Eâ€‹(ğ’˜)â‰¤ğ¸ğ’˜delimited-[]subscriptğ‘‡1subscriptğ’˜ğ¸ğ’˜absent\displaystyle E(\boldsymbol{w}[T_{1}])-\min_{\boldsymbol{w}}E(\boldsymbol{w})\leq 2â€‹[Fâ€‹(ğ’˜â€‹[T1])âˆ’Fâ€‹(ğ’˜o)]2delimited-[]ğ¹ğ’˜delimited-[]subscriptğ‘‡1ğ¹superscriptğ’˜ğ‘œ\displaystyle 2\left[F(\boldsymbol{w}[T_{1}])-F(\boldsymbol{w}^{o})\right]
+âˆ‘kâˆˆğ’¦pk2nkâ€‹Lâ„“2â€‹dâ€‹logâ¡(2â€‹d/Î´)2â€‹Î¼.subscriptğ‘˜ğ’¦superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘˜2subscriptğ‘›ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ¿â„“2ğ‘‘2ğ‘‘ğ›¿2ğœ‡\displaystyle+\sum_{k\in\mathcal{K}}\frac{p_{k}^{2}}{n_{k}}\frac{L_{\ell}^{2}d\log(2d/\delta)}{2\mu}. (125)

Therefore, we have the following holds with a probability of at least 1âˆ’Î´1ğ›¿1-\delta,

Eâ€‹(ğ’˜â€‹[T1])âˆ’minğ’˜â¡Eâ€‹(ğ’˜)â‰¤ğ¸ğ’˜delimited-[]subscriptğ‘‡1subscriptğ’˜ğ¸ğ’˜absent\displaystyle E(\boldsymbol{w}[T_{1}])-\min_{\boldsymbol{w}}E(\boldsymbol{w})\leq C1â€‹Lf2â€‹dâ€‹log2â¡(Kâ€‹n(1))â€‹logâ¡(1/Î´)K2â€‹n(1)2â€‹Ïµ2subscriptğ¶1superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘“2ğ‘‘superscript2ğ¾subscriptğ‘›11ğ›¿superscriptğ¾2superscriptsubscriptğ‘›12superscriptitalic-Ïµ2\displaystyle~{}C_{1}\frac{L_{f}^{2}d\log^{2}(Kn_{(1)})\log(1/\delta)}{K^{2}n_{(1)}^{2}\epsilon^{2}}
+âˆ‘kâˆˆğ’¦pk2nkâ€‹Lâ„“2â€‹dâ€‹logâ¡(2â€‹d/Î´)2â€‹Î¼,subscriptğ‘˜ğ’¦superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘˜2subscriptğ‘›ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ¿â„“2ğ‘‘2ğ‘‘ğ›¿2ğœ‡\displaystyle+\sum_{k\in\mathcal{K}}\frac{p_{k}^{2}}{n_{k}}\frac{L_{\ell}^{2}d\log(2d/\delta)}{2\mu}, (126)

for some constants C1>0subscriptğ¶10C_{1}>0.

IX-N Proof of Proposition 11

We first define

From Lgsubscriptğ¿ğ‘”L_{g}-smoothness assumption, it follows that

=âˆ’Î·22â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡Jâˆ’kâ€‹(ğ’˜â€‹[t])âˆ¥22+Î·2â€‹ğ”¼â€‹âˆ¥ğ’›âˆ¥22absentsubscriptğœ‚22subscriptsuperscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥âˆ‡subscriptğ½ğ‘˜ğ’˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡22ğœ‚2ğ”¼subscriptsuperscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥ğ’›22\displaystyle=-\frac{\eta_{2}}{2}\left\lVert\nabla J_{-k}(\boldsymbol{w}[t])\right\rVert^{2}_{2}+\frac{\eta}{2}\mathbb{E}\left\lVert\boldsymbol{z}\right\rVert^{2}_{2}
â‰¤âˆ’(Kâˆ’1)â€‹Î¼â€‹Î·2â€‹(Jâˆ’kâ€‹(ğ’˜â€‹[t])âˆ’Jâˆ’kâˆ—)+dâ€‹Î·2â€‹Ïƒ22.absentğ¾1ğœ‡subscriptğœ‚2subscriptğ½ğ‘˜ğ’˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ½ğ‘˜ğ‘‘subscriptğœ‚2superscriptğœ22\displaystyle\leq-(K-1)\mu\eta_{2}(J_{-k}(\boldsymbol{w}[t])-J_{-k}^{*})+\frac{d\eta_{2}\sigma^{2}}{2}. (128)

Therefore, we have that

ğ”¼â€‹[Jâˆ’kâ€‹(ğ’˜lâ€‹[t+1])]âˆ’Jâˆ’kâ€‹(ğ’˜lâˆ—)â‰¤ğ”¼delimited-[]subscriptğ½ğ‘˜subscriptğ’˜ğ‘™delimited-[]ğ‘¡1subscriptğ½ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ’˜ğ‘™absent\displaystyle\mathbb{E}[J_{-k}(\boldsymbol{w}_{l}[t+1])]-J_{-k}(\boldsymbol{w}_{l}^{*})\leq (1âˆ’Î·2â€‹(Kâˆ’1)â€‹Î¼)1subscriptğœ‚2ğ¾1ğœ‡\displaystyle\left(1-\eta_{2}(K-1)\mu\right)

(129)

Summing over t=0,â€¦,T2ğ‘¡0â€¦subscriptğ‘‡2t=0,...,T_{2} iterations, we have that

ğ”¼â€‹[Jâˆ’kâ€‹(ğ’˜â€‹[t+1])]âˆ’Jâˆ’kâ€‹(ğ’˜lâˆ—)â‰¤ğ”¼delimited-[]subscriptğ½ğ‘˜ğ’˜delimited-[]ğ‘¡1subscriptğ½ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ’˜ğ‘™absent\displaystyle\mathbb{E}[J_{-k}(\boldsymbol{w}[t+1])]-J_{-k}(\boldsymbol{w}_{l}^{*})\leq (1âˆ’Î·2â€‹(Kâˆ’1)â€‹Î¼)T2superscript1subscriptğœ‚2ğ¾1ğœ‡subscriptğ‘‡2\displaystyle\left(1-\eta_{2}(K-1)\mu\right)^{T_{2}}
Ã—(Jâˆ’kâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ—)âˆ’Jâˆ’kâ€‹(ğ’˜lâˆ—))absentsubscriptğ½ğ‘˜superscriptğ’˜subscriptğ½ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ’˜ğ‘™\displaystyle\times(J_{-k}(\boldsymbol{w}^{*})-J_{-k}(\boldsymbol{w}_{l}^{*})) +dâ€‹Ïƒ22â€‹(Kâˆ’1)â€‹Î¼.ğ‘‘superscriptğœ22ğ¾1ğœ‡\displaystyle+\frac{d\sigma^{2}}{2(K-1)\mu}. (130)

Note that

Jâˆ’kâ€‹(ğ’˜âˆ—)âˆ’Jâˆ’kâ€‹(ğ’˜lâˆ—)â€‹â‰¤(a)â€‹(Kâˆ’1)â€‹Lf22â€‹Î¼=B,subscriptğ½ğ‘˜superscriptğ’˜subscriptğ½ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ’˜ğ‘™ğ‘ğ¾1superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘“22ğœ‡ğµ\displaystyle J_{-k}(\boldsymbol{w}^{*})-J_{-k}(\boldsymbol{w}_{l}^{*})\overset{(a)}{\leq}\frac{(K-1)L_{f}^{2}}{2\mu}=B, (131)

where (a)ğ‘(a) is due to the fact that (Kâˆ’1)2â€‹Lf2/2â‰¥1/2â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡Jâˆ’kâ€‹(ğ’˜)âˆ¥22â‰¥(Kâˆ’1)â€‹Î¼â€‹(Jâˆ’kâ€‹(ğ’˜)âˆ’Jâˆ’kâ€‹(ğ’˜kâˆ—))â‰¥(Kâˆ’1)â€‹Î¼â€‹(Jâˆ’kâ€‹(ğ’˜)âˆ’Jâˆ’kâ€‹(ğ’˜lâˆ—))superscriptğ¾12superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘“2212superscriptsubscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥âˆ‡subscriptğ½ğ‘˜ğ’˜22ğ¾1ğœ‡subscriptğ½ğ‘˜ğ’˜subscriptğ½ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜ğ¾1ğœ‡subscriptğ½ğ‘˜ğ’˜subscriptğ½ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ’˜ğ‘™(K-1)^{2}L_{f}^{2}/2\geq 1/2\left\lVert\nabla J_{-k}(\boldsymbol{w})\right\rVert_{2}^{2}\geq(K-1)\mu(J_{-k}(\boldsymbol{w})-J_{-k}(\boldsymbol{w}_{k}^{*}))\geq(K-1)\mu(J_{-k}(\boldsymbol{w})-J_{-k}(\boldsymbol{w}_{l}^{*})) for all ğ’˜ğ’˜\boldsymbol{w} due to the strong convexity of Jâˆ’kâ€‹(ğ’˜)subscriptğ½ğ‘˜ğ’˜J_{-k}(\boldsymbol{w}) and ğ’˜kâˆ—=argâ¡minâ¡Jâˆ’kâ€‹(ğ’˜)superscriptsubscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜subscriptğ½ğ‘˜ğ’˜\boldsymbol{w}_{k}^{*}=\arg\min J_{-k}(\boldsymbol{w}).

Recall that

Ïƒ2superscriptğœ2\displaystyle\sigma^{2} =16â€‹Lf2â€‹(T1+Kâ€‹T2)â€‹logâ¡(1/Î²)K2â€‹n(1)2â€‹Î±2.absent16superscriptsubscriptğ¿ğ‘“2subscriptğ‘‡1ğ¾subscriptğ‘‡21ğ›½superscriptğ¾2superscriptsubscriptğ‘›12superscriptğ›¼2\displaystyle=\frac{16L_{f}^{2}(T_{1}+KT_{2})\log(1/\beta)}{K^{2}n_{(1)}^{2}\alpha^{2}}. (132)

Collectively, the following serves as an upper bound for the right hand side of (130):

Cğ¶\displaystyle C =1âˆ’(Kâˆ’1)â€‹Î¼â€‹Î·2.absent1ğ¾1ğœ‡subscriptğœ‚2\displaystyle=1-(K-1)\mu\eta_{2}. (136)

In addition, the choice of T2subscriptğ‘‡2T_{2} in (57) is to minimize the value in (133).
